title: IOS Developer for Mobile App
description:
We are seeking a talented iOS Developer to join our team. As an iOS Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our high-quality mobile application! We are on a mission to become the #1 Social media Mobile app in the world, and we know we can do it with the right team. We are offering several opportunities to potential developers that join our team. Imagine of you had the option to join Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, or Tik Tok when they first launched. Here is your opportunity to join the next big social media app on the planet! Allow us to share our vision for the app to see if we are the right fit. We are looking for interns to join the company than after that we will be bringing you on full time to the team here in california. Potential Equity opportunities and partnerships for talented developers!

Check us out on the apple store: Snips | Up Next Entrepreneurs

Below would be some responsibilities you would be handling:

**PHP Laravel Developer**  
**Responsibilities:**  
- Develop, record, and maintain cutting-edge web-based PHP applications using Laravel framework  
- Build innovative, state-of-the-art applications and collaborate with the User Experience (UX) team  
- Prepare and maintain all applications utilizing standard development tools  
- Utilize backend data services and contribute to increasing existing data services API  
- Design and build new APIs to support the iOS app functionality  
- Coordinate with co-developers and keep project manager well informed of the status of development effort, serving as a liaison between development staff and project manager  
- Work with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic  
- Troubleshoot and resolve bugs and issues in existing web applications  
- Follow industry best practices and contribute to internal coding standards  
- Keep up-to-date with the latest web development trends, techniques, and technologies  
**Requirements:**  
- Proven software development experience in PHP, Laravel framework  
- Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git  
- Experience working with AWS services is a plus  
- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail  
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team  
- Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams  
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
**iOS Swift 5 Developer**  
**Responsibilities:**  
- Design and build advanced applications for the iOS platform using Swift 5  
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features  
- Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability  
- Work on bug fixing and improving application performance  
- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency  
- Maintain code quality, organization, and automatization  
- Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications  
- Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs  
- Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization

**Requirements:**  
- Proven software development experience in iOS app development using Swift 5  
- Strong understanding of iOS design principles, patterns, and best practices  
- Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc.  
- Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services  
- Experience with performance and memory tuning with tools  
- Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git  
- Experience with cloud services such as AWS for iOS app hosting is a plus  
- Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle  
- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail  
- Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary, Internship

Pay: $57.15 - $68.82 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance
* Relocation assistance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities
* Performance bonus

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: iOS Developer
description:
The Mobile Specialist participates in project planning, including resource estimation, and in the creation and review of technical deliverables. The Mobile Specialist works in conjunction with other technical team members in all phases of the Agile Scrum SDLC.

This position will participate as a key technical position for DEP’s mobile inspection applications. The mobile inspection applications are being built on an iOS platform. The resulting data is received into DEP’s enterprise system via services. The backend database is Oracle 19C. This position will be responsible for serving as the designer, developer and/or engineer on multiple mobile inspection applications. They will work with the end user stakeholders at times, various Business Analysts (BAs) and Project Managers (PMs), and other technical staff in defining and managing the business and technical requirements. The candidate will be responsible for developing and/or engineering a user interface, a service tier, data tier components, and/or infrastructure or security for the mobile projects by working with the team leads.

Attention to reusable components and repeatable processes is required for developing the iOS solutions utilizing, but not limited to, Objective C, Swift, JSON, XML, and consumption of RESTful web services. The candidate will develop applications that link to a web service-oriented backend solution.

Additionally, a solid understanding and experience in Apple’s technologies is required, including but not limited to the distribution of certificates, provisioning profiles, code signing, keychains, push notifications, app transport requirements, and iOS version histories. The candidate should have a strong knowledge of iOS frameworks related to UI, Core Data, storyboards, web services, security/keychain, camera integration, asynchronous/background processing, multitasking, etc. Also, a strong understanding of MVC, delegation, target-action and Cocoa layers related to Touch, Media, OS and Services and Objective/C and iOS principles of memory management, notifications, blocks, categories, etc. is strongly helpful.

The ideal candidate will assist in project planning, including the development of timelines. They must understand Agile Scrum methodology and participate in daily standups. The selected candidate is expected to assist in the development and review of technical deliverables on the projects.

**Required/Desired Skills:**

Required - 6yrs - Full SDLC experience as an application developer

Required - 5yrs - Experience with object-oriented development

Required - 5yrs - Experience with iOS SDK and Objective-C

Required - 5yrs - Familiarity with Swift programming language and latest iOS APIs and frameworks

Required - 5yrs - Experience with Core Data framework

Required - 5yrs - Experience with relational database design and development

Required - 4yrs - Experience with iOS Auto Layout, Storyboard, Blocks and GCD

Required - 2yrs - Experience in architecting & solutioning mobile apps that consumes web services

**Desired Skills:**

Highly desired - 5yrs - Experience with deploying iOS apps

Highly desired - 1yrs - Experience in a team leadership position

Highly desired - 1yrs - Experience with deploying enterprise iOS apps via MDM

Highly desired - 5yrs - Experience with HTML5 development and JavaScript frameworks

Highly desired - 2yrs - Experience with Java centric server-side development and solutioning

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $70.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Compensation package:

* Hourly pay
* Performance bonus

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* iOS: 5 years (Preferred)
* Mobile Development: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Ionic Mobile Engineer
description:
**Ionic Mobile Developer** 

**Job Description:**

We are looking for a skilled Ionic Mobile Developer who is proficient in Ionic, Angular, and ­­ Typescript. We are embarking on an exciting business growth agenda and digital transformation and need talented and passionate members to join our team! You will play a major role in championing, designing, and building UI Framework and Site Development in an Agile environment working closely with Product Owners in the Business/Marketing and Application Development teams.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop robust and responsive applications using Ionic framework with Angular for web and mobile platforms.
* Publish iOS and Android apps to the Apple and Google app store environments.
* Expert experience with application telemetry tools for user experience monitoring and performance optimization
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Work through the entire app life cycle concept including Envision, Architect, Build, Deploy, Test and Release the Application to production.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications by troubleshooting issues and optimizing code.
* Stay updated with the latest technologies and best practices in Ionic and Angular to enhance application development.
* Work with version control tools such as github in debugging and maintaining Android and iOS applications.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Additional Responsibilities and Job Requirements:**

* Design and develop well-tested, high-performing, and scalable cross-platform Mobile Hybrid applications on the Ionic platform for iOS and Android platforms.
* Work with Product and UX to understand customer requirements and collaborate on the design of new features and strong UX design principles.
* Collaborate with other team members in an agile environment.
* Drive development best practices, including unit testing, coding standards, code reviews, and industry-standard architecture.
* Identify, propose, and implement best-fit solutions in a complex business environment.
* Apply corporate technical standards, procedures, and policies to resolve incidents and issues promptly.
* Ensure technical solutions meet business needs and that customer satisfaction with the delivered solution.
* Very strong knowledge of Apple and Google app store environments, including publishing releases, rolling back release and the approval cycles.
* Assure a high standard of quality in your own work and peers.
* Excellent communication skills

**Education and Experience:**

· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Technology or equivalent required.

* Certification in any hybrid mobile application platform is a must.
* 5+ years of hybrid mobile development (Ionic Framework)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching

* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities
* Performance bonus
* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 3 years
* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Product Analyst/Business Analyst
description:
Job Title: Product Analyst / Business Analyst

Location: Remote

Contract: 6+Months

**Top skills**

* **Having prior Ad tech experience.**
* **A strong understanding of Data and very proficient at SQL**

**Product Analyst**

We are seeking a talented and motivated Product Analyst with a strong background in AdTech to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing, optimizing, and driving the performance of our advertising technology products. Your insights and expertise will play a crucial role in enhancing user engagement, maximizing revenue, and ensuring seamless user experiences across our mobile applications.

**Key Responsibilities:**

· **AdTech Expertise:**

· Develop a deep understanding of our AdTech stack, including ad serving platforms, ad formats/ delivery experiences, supply and demand dimensions, partner programming requirements, campaign scoring, budget pacing, audience management and user-level targeting capabilities.

· Monitor and analyze key advertising performance metrics, such as click-through rates (CTR), conversion rates, impression delivery, and ad revenue.

· Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to optimize ad placements, ad targeting, and overall user engagement to maximize revenue and user satisfaction.

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement ad-related enhancements and ensure alignment with product strategy.

· Conduct A/B tests and analyze user behavior to make data-driven recommendations for improving user experience, as well as app/ad performance across our network

· **Data Analysis and Insights:**

· **Dig deep.** You will utilize data analytics tools to perform in-depth analysis of user engagement, ad performance, and app usage patterns across dozens of supply-side dimensions.

· **Make data accessible.** You will build product performance dashboards and workbooks using data visualization tools and pivot tables to effectively communicate performance trends to stakeholders.

· **Draw Insights**. You will highlight key findings, generate actionable insights, and propose optimizations/ recommendations based on data, contributing to product roadmaps and strategies.

· **Be the “SME”.** You are the go-to person when someone asks questions like: “is this feature working”, “when do these events fire”, “how should we interpret this graph”, or “what does this value mean”.

· **Define “healthy”.** You will help to define performance expectations and monitoring requirements for new features so that we can quickly identify when issues arise.

· **Collaboration and Communication:**

· Work closely with product managers, software developers, and UX/UI designers to drive product enhancements and feature development.

· Assist data science with discovery, investigations and insights to steer the development of machine learning algorithms.

· Collaborate with engineering teams to troubleshoot technical issues.

· Effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, promoting a clear understanding of product performance and potential improvements.

**Qualifications:**

· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.

· Proven experience (5+ years) in **product analysis, AdTech, and Android platform analysis.**

· Proficiency in data analysis tools such as **Excel, SQL, Python, or similar languages.**

· Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights.

· Natural tendency to be curious and creative

· Familiarity with mobile application development, Android Studio, and related SDKs.

Thanks & Regards

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $55.00 - $60.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Ad tech: 5 years (Required)
* Media: 4 years (Required)
* sql: 3 years (Required)
* Python: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Software Engineer II, Mobile
description:
### **About the Role**



We are looking for a Software Engineer II with experience in iOS and Android for our Mobile Platform team — in our San Francisco office or remotely. Our team owns the shared iOS component library, our build and deployment processes, other third-party SDK integrations, and our Android app. The work we do serves our clients by prioritizing accessibility, app performance, and a consistent user experience. We multiply the efforts of other iOS teams by maintaining a strong platform for other engineers, and continuously improving the developer experience in our app so that feature engineers can do better work, faster.



You will deliver solutions—not just features—by developing an understanding of how Stitch Fix works. We trust you to focus your time and efforts where they are needed most. Your commitment to applying technology to business challenges in clean & innovative ways will make you a trusted advisor to your partners and their teams. You will own projects and influence our direction.



You won’t do this alone. Your team will collaborate with business partners to define product requirements, plans, and deliverables. You will work with team members to take advantage of learning and growth opportunities in tech and product through real day-to-day work. You will impact the business in tangible, visible ways, and always have a seat at the table.



As part of our engineering team, you will work with product and technical stakeholders and other native mobile engineering team members to design, break down, implement and ship user-facing features for native mobile applications. You will help with technical decision making on the Mobile team, learning about the architecture of how we build major new mobile efforts at Stitch Fix as we broaden the impact of mobile across Stitch Fix. You will provide feedback to other engineers on their implementations and receive feedback on your own. You will drive business and client impact by focusing on short term goals and strategic milestones for the future. You will work with other engineers to grow their skills alongside your own, and collaborate with close stakeholders from other disciplines such as Product and Design.



We cannot succeed without creative engineers. Your cross-functional team will propose and build solutions to move the state of the art of Stitch Fix mobile technology forward.


### **Our Tech Stack Includes...**


* Reactive Patterns
* Swift (latest)
* GraphQL
* Combine
* SwiftUI and UIKit
* Quick & Nimble
* Kotlin

  



Even if you already have experience with these tools, you'll have the chance to get even better with them. And if you don't already use these tools, we will help you learn and become effective with them.



You’re excited about this opportunity because...


* We work collaboratively as a distributed team—we are a primarily remote team and we use GitHub, Slack, and video conferencing extensively to collaborate.
* You will have the opportunity to participate in creating prototypes and exploring alternative designs—we value pull requests, one-pagers, and screencasts to develop rapid prototypes that demonstrate new features.
* Our workflow depends on testing and CI—we take testing and test automation seriously in order to build software we can rely on, and use CircleCI to bring it all together.
* We have a distributed, service-oriented architecture—we’re using tools like GraphQL, RabbitMQ, Kafka, ElasticSearch, and headless HTTP services to scale our team and software.


We use these tools and techniques to help us get the job done and we’re excited to share our expertise with new members of the team. You will have the opportunity to help us continue to adopt effective practices and technologies and explore their full potential.



We are excited about you because...


* Have roughly 2 years of professional programming experience (and maybe more)
* Have worked in native iOS and Android apps, using Swift and Kotlin
* Are bright, kind, and motivated by challenge.
* Have excellent analytical skills as well as communication skills: both verbal and written.
* Love to learn, and love helping your team members learn and grow.
* Take initiative and operate with accountability.
* Are motivated by solving problems and finding creative solutions that solve problems for our clients and other engineers on the team.
* Build high-quality solutions and are pragmatic about weighing project scope and value.
* Are flexible, dedicated to your craft, and curious.
* Have experience working remotely alongside a distributed software engineering team.
* *Might* have experience with MVVM app architecture.
* *Might* have experience with both UIKit and SwiftUI.
* *Might* have prior experience on a platform team, or doing mobile platform work.

  



You'll love working at Stitch Fix because we...


* We are a group of bright, kind people who are motivated by challenge. We value integrity, innovation and trust. You’ll bring these characteristics to life in everything you do at Stitch Fix.
* We cultivate a community of diverse perspectives— all voices are heard and valued.
* We are an innovative company and leverage our strengths in fashion and tech to disrupt the future of retail.
* We win as a team, commit to our work, and celebrate grit together because we value strong relationships.
* We boldly create the future while keeping equity and sustainability at the center of all that we do.
* We are the owners of our work and are energized by solving problems through a growth mindset lens. We think broadly and creatively through every situation to create meaningful impact.
* We offer comprehensive compensation packages and inclusive health and wellness benefits.

### **About Stitch Fix**



We're changing the industry and bringing personal styling to every body. We believe in a service and a workplace where you can show up as your best, most authentic self. The Stitch Fix experience is not merely curated—it’s truly personalized to each client we style. We are changing the way people find what they love. We’re disrupting the future of retail with the precision of data science by combining it with human instinct to find pieces that fit our client’s unique style. This novel juxtaposition attracts a highly diverse group of talented people who are both thinkers and doers. This results in a simple, yet powerful offering to our customers and a successful, growing business serving millions of men, women and kids throughout the US. We believe we are only scratching the surface and are looking for incredible people like you to help us boldly create our future.


**Compensation and Benefits**  

  

Our anticipated compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets, and the range below indicates the low end of the lowest-compensated market to the high end of the highest-compensated market. This position is eligible for new hire and ongoing grants of restricted stock units depending on employee and company performance. In addition, the position is eligible for medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external careers site.
Salary Range
$129,000—$139,500 USD
*This link* *leads to the machine readable files that are made available in response to the federal Transparency in Coverage Rule and includes negotiated service rates and out-of-network allowed amounts between health plans and healthcare providers. The machine-readable files are formatted to allow researchers, regulators, and application developers to more easily access and analyze data.*



Please review Stitch Fix's US Applicant Privacy Policy and Notice at Collection here: https://stitchfix.com/careers/workforce-applicant-privacy-policy


**Recruiting Fraud Alert:**



To all candidates: your personal information and online safety are top of mind for us. At Stitch Fix, recruiters only direct candidates to apply through our official career pages at https://www.stitchfix.com/careers/jobs or https://web.fountain.com/c/stitch-fix.



Recruiters will never request payments, ask for financial account information or sensitive information like social security numbers. If you are unsure if a message is from Stitch Fix, please email RecruitingOperations@stitchfix.com.



You can read more about Recruiting Scam Awareness on our FAQ page here: https://support.stitchfix.com/hc/en-us/articles/1500007169402-Recruiting-Scam-Awareness

title: iOS Mobile Web Developer, Mid-level - FAA
description:
**Position:****iOS Mobile Developer, Mid-level - FAA**

  


**Location:** Remote Site/Cobec Site- Washington, D.C.

  



Salary Range: $60k- $80k

  


**Job Summary**

  



We are looking for iOS developers who will be responsible for the development and maintenance of mobile applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablets.This position will apply advanced mobile development techniques to solve complex decision problems. The candidate will work in a team to develop application programming interfaces (APIs) to support mobile functionality while keeping up to date with terminology, concepts and best practices for coding mobile apps. Essentially, contributing to the design, testing, releasing and support of the application. This position will support the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA).

  


**Years of Relevant Experience**

  



The position requires 2-5 equivalent years of experience in mobile web development.

  




**Required Skills**


* Experience with Asp.net Core, Asp.net Framework, EntityFramework, C#, and MAUI


* Experience in mobile iOS development with programming language: MAUI for iOS for TAP app.


* Experience developing applications in an Oracle/SL environment


* Ability to work in a SAFe agile team environment


* Familiarity with OOP design principles

  


**Essential Job Functions**

  



The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from this position if the work is similar, related, and/or a logical assignment for this position. Other duties may be required and assigned.

  





* Work in team environment with team of web developers and coders


* Software developer/computer programmer responsible to develop and test new logging application – Tech Ops Activity Portal (TAP app) mobile iOS application


* Develop role on SAFE agile team following SAFe agile framework methodology


* Provide database support as needed to integrate the applications with the database system


* Provide field support for software applications


* Troubleshoot, research, resolve application problems


* Provide support for deployment and training of the application


* Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market


* Experience with third-party libraries and APIs


* Superior analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude


* Strong oral and written communication skills


* Ability to interpret and follow technical plans


* Identify and plan for new features


* Develop application programming interfaces (APIs) to support mobile functionality


* Suggest and implement new mobile products, applications and protocols


* Remain up to date with the terminology, concepts and best practices for coding mobile apps


* Work closely with colleagues to constantly innovate app functionality and design


* Use and adapt existing web applications for apps


* Write unit and UI tests to identify malfunctions


* Developing new features and user interfaces from wireframe models


* Ensuring the best performance and user experience of the application


* Fixing bugs and performance problems


* Writing clean, readable, and testable code


* Cooperating with back-end developers, designers, and the rest of the team to deliver well-architected and high-quality solutions

  


**Education Requirements**



Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree is a plus.

  



**Security Requirements**



Must be a US citizen or a legal resident for three of the past five years.



Must meet eligibility requirements for a US Public Trust security clearance.

  


**Travel**



Occasional travel required as needed by client/s and/or company

title: Software Developer
description:
Job Description:  

### **Software Developer – Laramie, WY, Fort Collins, CO, or Remote**

**Trihydro is looking for a full-time .NET developer to support its environmental compliance products. The software developer will join our team and assist with developing, creating, and testing new software features. If you are a driven, innovative developer who loves to learn, we encourage you to apply!**


### **Position Overview**
**As a software developer, you will be responsible for developing, creating, and testing new software features. You will work with a small team of developers, project managers, and a quality assurance (QA) team to build and enhance SaaS products. We are searching for developers who are willing to learn and implement software for solutions that include mobile app development, websites, REST services, and database management.**


### **The position will primarily use the Microsoft .NET Framework, C#, REST Services, SQL server, React Native, and various Cloud Computing platforms and will work with HTML5, Entity Framework, CSS, JavaScript, and the MVC framework.**


### **This is a full-time, benefited position that will allow you to build your project portfolio while making a tangible difference for clients and communities.**


### **Location**
**This position can be based in Laramie, WY, Fort Collins, CO, or remote. Our Laramie and Fort Collins offices are situated in growing communities that provide access to exceptional outdoor recreation opportunities.**


### **We encourage you to apply if you:**


* ### **Have a B.S. in computer science or a related field**
* ### **Have 2+ years’ experience developing software using C#, .NET, and the MVC framework**
* ### **Have experience with various databases including relational and NoSQL databases**
* ### **Have experience developing RESTful APIs**
* ### **Are familiar with cloud-based data management systems**
* ### **Possess strong technical and problem-solving skills**
* ### **Possess attention to detail, accuracy, and completeness**
* ### **Are a strong communicator**
* ### **Understand the importance of time management and possess excellent organizational skills**

### **This job is for you if:**


* ### **You desire career-growth opportunities and are interested in playing an integral role in a growing team and company**
* ### **You value working on meaningful projects that make a difference to our clients and our communities**
* ### **You assume ownership of your work and take pride in producing high-quality deliverables**

### **Benefits**
**At Trihydro, our approach to work is honest and hard-working. You’ll find a company culture that is dedicated to excellence, nurtures collaboration and growth, and still finds plenty of time for fun. Some of the benefits of joining our team include:**


* ### **Comprehensive health insurance program (medical, dental, vision, and prescription)**
* ### **An industry-leading 401(k) retirement plan, including a 6% discretionary match by Trihydro**
* ### **Generous paid time off including vacation, flex, sick, paid family leave and holiday pay**
* ### **A wellness program, including reimbursement for gym membership or related expenses**
* ### **Staff mentoring and opportunities for professional/career advancement**
* ### **A best-in-class safety culture built to protect our employees—the mothers, fathers, sons, and daughters who deserve to go home safely each night**

### **Trihydro is humbled to have received an honorable mention in Outside Magazine’s “Best Places to Work” list. Our 500+ professionals work on meaningful environmental and engineering projects that make a difference for clients and communities. Trihydro’s offices extend from Alaska to Florida, and our team members live and work within minutes of outdoor recreation. As a team of geologists, engineers, ecologists, and scientists, our culture is rooted in a love for the outdoors.**


### **The salary information shown below is a general guideline ONLY. Salaries are based on candidates' experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.**


### **Summary pay range: $60,000 – $90,000**


### **This position will remain open until a qualified candidate has been selected.**

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
MembersFirst’s Technical Support Engineer (TSE) is the company point person on all integration related support issues and projects. This includes complex requests requiring understanding of third party services and how they integrate with MembersFirst. The TSE must work effectively with team members at all levels of the organization, including but not limited to Client Services Managers and Project Managers. It is the TSE’s responsibility to be the liaison between the development team and all other teams of the company for day-to-day requests.

ResponsibilitiesTechnical Support

* Respond, comment, or assist to tickets/cases presented by the CSM’s requesting for TSE support.
* Technical contact for all teams in the company to get updates on where integration requests currently reside.
* Work directly with MembersFirst clients and/or the client's IT team to troubleshoot their specific needs
* Connect remotely to client servers to troubleshoot connectivity issues with MembersFirst

Integrations

* Responsible for managing (and fixing where applicable) any dev-related integration bugs that are reported by various teams.
* Facilitate client interaction related to integration projects; driving the integration project from concept to completion.
* Participate in client meetings organized by PM's for Integration related projects
* Organize MembersFirst & Jonas combined projects to ensure a successful customer experience.

Development

* Custom development scoping and implementation where possible.
* Working closely with the development team on any dev projects, deliverables and messaging to clients/staff.
* Intimate knowledge of the Development Team’s priorities and current projects. Driving development projects to be completed to spec and on time. When possible, assist the development team directly in completing projects.
* Manage multiple database (SQL) tasks related to integrations including creating views, and running update statements when required.

Mobile App

* Assist the Professional Services team with launching mobile apps for clients
* Manage the existing mobile apps and keeping them up to date
* Assist the Client Services team in managing Apple Developer accounts
* Be the owner of the Mobile App Management Process

Competencies

* Has the functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job at a high level of accomplishment. Is good at learning new technical knowledge through taking their own initiatives.
* Come up with creative solutions to problems, discovered via effective listening.
* Effectively manage time in order to set clear priorities of tasks while using efficient workflows to meet deadlines.
* Ability to work alone on multiple projects while anticipating future developments or issues.
* Sought out by others for advice and solutions to provide the information people need to know to do their jobs.
* Comfortable interacting with higher management to provide valuable feedback.

Required Technical Skills

* Microsoft T-SQL
* HTML
* CSS
* Javascript

Bonus Technical Skills

* Classic ASP
* C# and ASP.NET
* Bash
* Google Suite
* JIRA
* Github

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* SQL: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: nCino Developer
description:
**Title: Senior Salesforce nCino Developer IV**

**Location: Remote**

**Duration: 6+ Months** 

**Job Description:**

We need a senior Salesforce Developer with experience & expertise in implementing nCino solutions.

**Required:**

* Proven understanding of and experience with Salesforce.com architecture and APIs
* Experience working on multiple Salesforce products, i.e. Experience Cloud, Sales Cloud, Financial Services Cloud, etc.
* Proven experience configuring out of the box Salesforce features like Flows, Process Builder, Workflows, Validation Rules, Custom Settings etc.
* Proven experience writing Visualforce, Apex classes and triggers as per best practices and enterprise level frameworks
* Proven experience with SOQL/SOSL
* Ability to design, code, test, debug, and maintain Salesforce1 customizations (including integrations)
* Experience integrating Salesforce1 platform with other applications via real-time, batch, sync/async
* Demonstrative success with at least one large Salesforce.com integration project
* Experience working with managed app on Salesforce1 platform

title: Senior Android Engineer (Video/Audio)
description:
**Senior/Staff Android Developer (Video/Audio)**  

**6 month Contract/Day Rate**


**Who are we??**



Live streaming is a great medium for storytelling – and telling great stories benefits everyone. Whether you’re a creator, content marketer, entrepreneur, or just someone with something to say, live streaming is an exciting and effective way to spread your message. But live streaming tools are very complicated. You shouldn’t need to spend thousands of dollars on a computer or learn about encoding, just to start live streaming. The world misses out on so many great creators because of these barriers. Dan and Geige thought there should be a streaming tool that anyone could use – a tool that was fun instead of stressful – a tool that was simple, but powerful enough to create engaging content. We wanted people who weren’t techy, or who simply didn’t want to deal with the hassle of streaming, to still go live, share their stories, and grow their own communities.



Geige and Dan built StreamYard with three things in mind and continue to focus on these pillars today. The three StreamYard pillars include



* ease of use


* stability, and


* professional streams



StreamYard is built on those pillars. Our users tell us that StreamYard makes streaming fun – you can quickly create engaging content with guests, show on screen comments/lower thirds, and brand your broadcasts with themes, overlays, and backgrounds. You don’t need to know anything about technology or streaming to get started. And even though StreamYard is simple, techy folks love how powerful it is under the hood, and how effective it is for streaming group discussions.



We love StreamYard and its community. We work tirelessly to improve our tool and create the best experience possible.


**The Role**



StreamYard is seeking a contractor with expertise in video and audio capture on Android to to join our mobile team for a really exciting six month contract. You will work on the development of a brand new Android application that people can use to live stream and record with StreamYard. It should be able to support a variety of recording features that previously would have only been performant enough for desktop devices.


**Responsibilities**


* The development of a greenfield Android application that people can use to live stream or record alongside other hosts and guests.
* Help port an existing iOS SDK to Android.
* Build pixel-perfect, buttery smooth UIs using the latest technologies (e.g. Jetpack Compose)
* Leverage native APIs for deep integrations with Android platforms for the following:
+ Camera and Audio capture including saving local recordings to disk
+ Handling USB microphone sources
+ Rendering videos, images and other content (e.g. comments) on screen in a high-performance way.
+ Uploading video content while the app is running and also in the background.

* Diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks
* Get your hands dirty with the WebRTC source code, if necessary.
* Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
* Support the team using React Native to integrate with the new SDK.


**About You**


* Experienced Senior or Staff Android Engineer with extensive knowledge and experience in building and deploying Android applications
* A track record of developing highly complex Android applications with Kotlin
* Expertise in developing applications involving audio/cameras and recording before.
* Able to upskill others and share your knowledge, you know how to set things up for success.

  


### **The Offer**


* Fully remote, global team
* Flexible schedules
* Laptop assigned, Mac or Dell (Windows)
* Health Insurance Support
* Parental Leave
* $1000 USD for Home-Office Set up
* $100 USD monthly remote work stipend
* $1500 USD for Learning & Development
  


**A little about us**  

  

We would love for you to try each of the platforms yourself, but for now, here’s a high level description of how each of the Hopin products work together as an ecosystem:


* StreamYard - great for creating professional live streams, multistreaming, recording video content, podcasts, and streaming webinars..
* Streamable - great for uploading, editing, and sharing your videos easily online.
* Superwave - great for building online community with conversations structured around content.


**Where and How We Hire**

Being a remote company enables us to hire the best talent from selected locations around the world. We can engage with you in any of our jurisdictions listed below, all you need to do is demonstrate the legal right to work and be physically present in that country. Some roles may have specific workforce location requirements which will be noted on the job description.


* **Entity:** Canada, UK, USA, Ireland
* **Employer of Record:** India, Portugal, Spain
* **Full Time Contractor** **(Self Employed):** Argentina, Honduras, Hungary, Poland, Romania, Turkey, U.A.E., Uruguay


**At Hopin**, we're committed to cultivating an environment that promotes equality, diversity, and inclusion. We are a global community and we believe our unique qualities must be celebrated as they are critical to our innovation. It's essential to us that you bring your authentic self to work every single day, no matter your age, ethnicity, religion, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, neurodiversity, or otherwise. Inclusion isn't just an initiative at Hopin. We strive to embed it not just into our core values but throughout our entire ecosystem.

title: Freelance Front End Developer
description:
***This is a freelance role.***

Gramercy Consultants, LLC (“Gramercy Tech”) is an award winning digital agency that was born out of the need to bring digital experiences to live events. We specialize in everything from concept creation, design, and software development to event management, credentialing and access control. Our team members are passionate about innovation, collaboration, and supporting one another. We are constantly striving to improve our platform and ourselves so that we can better support our clients.

Gramercy Tech is proud to be recognized by Clutch in their 2019 report as one of the top UX designers in New York and by Manifest as one of the top 25 IT services companies in New York. Additionally, we secured a spot on the Leader’s Matrix as a proven market leader and the top 8th UX consulting firm in New York City.

Our team is looking for a **Freelance Front End Developer** with extensive CSS and Javascript/jQuery experience that can help us manage and create content within our proprietary event CMS / platform, Eventfinity. The ideal candidate is passionate about design / UI / UX, is quick on their feet, has experience customizing content from top to bottom - especially within third party environments (think Squarespace, Weebly, Shopify, etc), and enjoys working in a fast paced environment.

This is not a traditional front end role -- the majority of work will be manipulating content in an existing structure/template, and implementing creative solutions utilizing Javascript/jQuery and CSS to accommodate client requests for customization. Experience working with a legacy codebase and existing within the confines of that environment is helpful.

The Eventfinity platform powers hybrid virtual events (e.g. agendas, video content, attendee directories, networking, chat rooms), as well as badge printing and mobile apps for in-person events. Front end developer responsibilities include working with project managers, clients, and the design team to bring events to life on the front end by editing plug-ins and client facing app code, strategizing around ways to use existing functionality to achieve client requests, or writing custom CSS and JS/jQuery to manipulate the current CMS functionalities and customize platform functionality. Candidates should have an eye for design and be well versed in JS / jQuery, CSS, and HTML.

Although the main focus of this role is almost entirely on the front-end side, there is always the possibility of growth; so knowledge of Vue, PHP, and Laravel is considered an important plus in order to facilitate communication between the front-end team and the back-end programmers who manage the development of the Eventfinity platform.

**Qualifications:**

* 2 or more years experience showing proficiency with front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery
* Experience building websites / microsites without relying on external frameworks is a huge plus, as you will be writing your own CSS / JS / HTML from scratch
* Familiarity with Ajax and asynchronous / dynamic content
* Experience creating complex mobile-first, responsive websites / microsites
* Solid understanding of cross browser/device responsive development
* Background in design / having a good eye for design, ability to pick up where mockups leave off
* Ability to manipulate the DOM while working within the confines of a CMS (Squarespace, Shopify, Weebly, etc)
* Experience utilizing Bootstrap framework
* Experience theming content within an existing platform; able to build a theme from the ground up, able to skin or build out a simple plugin, able to use a code editor to build complex JS/jQuery that will work within the platform, able to create readable and concise CSS
* Good understanding of ADA/WCAG compliance for an accessible web
* Experience debugging in the browser
* Understanding semantic structure and best JS / CSS practices to maintain optimization (understanding of caching/minification, image optimization, etc.)
* Strong communication / interpersonal skills, able to form productive working relationships while working remotely
* Ability to manage time and expectations while juggling multiple projects with different teams
* Excels under pressure and working with hard deadlines

**Job Type:** Temporary

*Salary based on skills and experience*

**Salary range:** $$20-$35 per hour

*Gramercy Consultants, LLC is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion or religious creed, color, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), genetic information, gender, gender identity and gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, uniform service member status, military and veteran status, tribal status, age, physical or mental disability, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.*

Job Type: Temporary

Pay: $20.00 - $35.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* On call

Application Question(s):

* Are you legally authorized to work in the United States?

Experience:

* Javascript: 2 years (Preferred)
* third-party environment (Squarespace, Weebly, Shopify): 1 year (Preferred)
* CSS: 2 years (Preferred)
* design: 2 years (Preferred)
* jQuery: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Meta Application Developer - South East Asia
description:
**Opportunities:*** Competitive hourly rate: **AUD 35 - AUD 50 per hour** (based on experience and location)
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and shape the future of Meta platforms.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment with opportunities for professional development.
* Competitive benefits package including health insurance, paid time off, and more.

**About the Role:**  

  

As a Meta Application Developer, you'll be at the forefront of creating engaging and impactful applications for Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and other Meta platforms. You'll collaborate with talented engineers, designers, and product managers to translate complex features into user-friendly experiences. This exciting role demands strong technical skills, a passion for innovation, and a commitment to building high-quality software.  

  

This role is initially envisioned to be a part-time role, but may progress into a full-time role.

* Demonstrates proficiency in programming languages like Java, Kotlin, React Native, or Python.
* Has experience working with APIs and integrating with various backend services.
* Understands best practices for mobile app development and clean code principles.
* Has a strong passion for user experience and building intuitive interfaces.
* Thrives in a collaborative and fast-paced environment.
* Possesses excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Enjoys taking initiative and working independently.

* Shares Meta's values of building responsible, inclusive, and empowering technologies.

Freedom Property Investors is the largest and fastest growing Property Investment Company in Australia, with main offices in Sydney and Melbourne CBD’s.  

  

We are currently the 3rd fastest-growing business in Australia across all industries according to the Australian Financial Review.

title: Engineer II (Power Platform Developer)
description:
**Our values start with our people, join a team that values you!**


We are the nation’s largest off-price retailer with over 2,000 stores, and a strong track record of success and growth. Our focus has always been bringing our customers a constant stream of high-quality brands and on-trend merchandise at extraordinary savings. All while providing a fun and exciting treasure hunt experience.  

As part of our team, you will experience:

* **Success.** Our winning team pursues excellence while learning and evolving
* **Career growth.** We develop industry leading talent because Ross grows when our people grow
* **Teamwork.** We work together to solve the hard problems and find the right solution
* **Our commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, and our community.** We celebrate the backgrounds, identities, and ideas of those who work and shop with us because our differences make us stronger. We strive to be a positive force in our community.


Our Corporate headquarters are in Dublin, CA, we have 3 buying offices in key markets in New York City, Los Angeles, and Boston, and 7 distribution centers nationwide. With 2022 revenues of $18.7 billion, we are a Fortune 500 company who is committed to providing an inclusive work environment with continuous learning opportunities and development for our teams.


Come see what’s in store: https://jobs.rossstores.com/creative/about

**GENERAL PURPOSE:**  

  

The Power Platform Developer will be responsible for developing applications using a low-code development platform, setting up and configuring systems for each business group's unique requirements. They will be developing- implementing- automating- and scaling the system design- system administration- and system deployment to deliver best-in-class services using Power Platform. They will assist with solutions engineering, strategy and research and development around business process management (BPM) and robotic process automation RPA tools. They will deliver enterprise applications with minimal traditional coding involved.  

  

The base salary range for this role is $93,200 - $176,550. The base salary range is dependent on factors including, but not limited to, experience, skills, qualifications, relevant education, certifications, seniority, and location. The range listed is just one component of the total compensation package for employees. Other rewards vary by position and location.  

  

Benefits offered to all Associates include Accident, Critical Illness, Vision, Auto, Home, and Pet insurance programs; Associate Discount, Identity Protection, Associate Purchase Program, Benefit Hub Discount Mall, Employee Assistance Program and Commuter Benefits, 401K (service requirements), Employee Stock Purchase Program, Ross Cares Fund, College Discounts, Sick Pay (where legally required) and Referral Bonuses. In addition, all Full-Time Associates, including FT Retail Associate, Area Supervisor, Assistant Store Manager and Store Manager, are eligible for extended benefits offered including Medical/Dental/Vision Health Insurance, Legal Insurance, Vacation Buy, Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Life/ADD Insurance, Long- Term Disability, Enhanced Maternity and Parental Leave Benefit, Vacation Pay accrued at a rate of 15 days/year, 15 Personal and Company Holidays. AS, ASM and SM Associates in Stores and Exempt Corporate and Merchandising roles are also eligible to receive a Bonus based on individual and business performance.  

  

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**  

  

* Be the subject matter expert for Digital Automation tools. Develop, design, and implement automated application built upon Microsoft Power Platform.

  

* Identifies opportunities to automate or improve existing processes.

  

* Business Process Management and RPA

  

o Work with form builders, pre-built templates and drag and drop visual entity builders  

  

o Research, design, and develop prototypes using automation technologies to demonstrate solution capabilities and fit for Ross environment.  

  

o Develop training tools (manuals, tip sheets, process flow documents), coordinate and conduct end-user training.  

  

o Write documentation to provide user support for programs and for production/operating procedures.  

  

* Low Code Development

  

o Work with form builders, pre-built templates and drag and drop visual entity builders  

  

o Research, design, and develop prototypes using low code technologies to demonstrate solution capabilities and fit for Ross environment.
  

  

o Develop training tools (manuals, tip sheets, process flow documents), coordinate and conduct end-user training.  

  

* Provide guidance and sharing best practices regarding Power Platform (Power Apps - with focus on Model -Driven Apps, Power Automate, etc.) development.

  

* Use Microsoft Power Platform CoE toolkit to set up standards, consistency, and governance

  

* Produce design and other technical documentation

  

**COMPETENCIES:**  

  

**People**  

  

* Building Effective Teams (for managers of People and/or Projects)

  

* Developing Talent (for managers of People)

  

* Collaboration

  

**Self**  

  

* Leading by Example

  

* Communicates Effectively

  

* Ensures Accountability and Execution

  

* Manages Conflict

  

**Business**  

  

* Business Acumen

  

* Plans, Aligns and Prioritizes

  

* Organizational Agility

  

**With particular emphasis on the following specific position-related competencies:**  

  

* Problem Solving

  

* Written Communications

  

* Integrity & Trust

  

* Dealing with Ambiguity

  

**QUALIFICATIONS AND SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED:**  

  

* 7+ years of experience in application design and development, with a minimum 3 year in developing Canvas and Model driven custom PowerApps applications based on specific business requirements.

  

* 3+ years of experience using Microsoft Flow and Power Automate to create customized, complex application data workflows and automated processes

  

* 3-5 years of experience with conducting and participating in design reviews and code reviews

  

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology or related field, or equivalent combination of education, industry certifications and relevant experience

  

* In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform, with a focus on PowerApps and Power Automate including RPA.

  

* Experience with low-code business application development and administration

  

* Support project and tech lead in development plans, estimation, and code and design reviews.

  

* Work within Power Platform Environments, Dataverse tables, and app deployments.

  

* Basic SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and general Web 2.0 techniques experience

  

* Ability to diagnose application issues and to decide what can be done with low-code instead of traditional coding (80/20 rule)

  

* Understanding of application security with general understanding of current security threats

  

* Conceptual and practical understanding of IT Infrastructure, products, and services, such as networking protocols, encryption, and other technologies.

  

* Demonstrated ability to learn and acquire new technologies in the areas of web & mobile application development

  

* Experience with using Agile development methods and processes

  

* Able to provide accurate estimates of timeframes necessary to complete potential projects and develop milestones and project implementation plans

  

* Ability to analyze and creatively solve complex technical problems

  

* Ability to work in a group setting and independently

  

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**  

  

* Experience with Nintex/K2 or other workflow tools

  

* Experience with Robotic Process Automation (RPA)

  

* Proficient in Microsoft Office products

  

* Familiar with modern development practices (Agile, DevOps, Continuous Integration / Deployment, etc.)

  

* Familiar with Monitoring tools like Dynatrace or Applications Insight

  

* Microsoft certification preferred (e.g., PL-900, PL-400, etc.)

  

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ADA:**  

  

This position requires the ability to work in an office environment, including using a computer, attending meetings, working as part of a team, and the ability to communicate with team members and others. Regular attendance also is a requirement of the position.
  

  

This position may be performed remotely anywhere within the United States. #LI-Remote  

  

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

  

N/A  

  

**DISCLAIMER:**  

  

This job description is a summary of the primary duties and responsibilities of the job and position. It is not intended to be a comprehensive or all-inclusive listing of duties and responsibilities. Contents are subject to change at management's discretion.  

  

Ross is an equal employment opportunity employer. We consider individuals for employment or promotion according to their skills, abilities and experience. We believe that it is an essential part of the Company's overall commitment to attract, hire and develop a strong, talented and diverse workforce. Ross is committed to complying with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, religious creed, age, national origin, ancestry, physical, mental or developmental disability, sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), veteran status, military status, marital or registered domestic partnership status, medical condition (including cancer or genetic characteristics), genetic information, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, as well as any other category protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
* *This position is eligible to be fully remote.*

 **JOB OVERVIEW:**
The Salesforce Administrator continually improves and enhances the Salesforce platform for internal and external clients by designing scalable solutions using best practices and technologies. **RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:*** Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration, dashboards and reports
* Management of roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, OWD, and sharing rules
* Data management to improve Salesforce data quality, implementing rules and automation as needed
* Sandbox environment management
* DevOps/release management experience
* Know when something should/could be done declaratively vs. pushing to the development team or a third-party app
* Integrate with the Development Team to handle the administrative side of custom code deployments
* Proactive system maintenance including Security Reviews, Release Updates, Health Check, and Optimizer
* Test changes and new features from internal developers and other administrators as well as external partners
* Research and know best practices for Salesforce and stay abreast of new features
* Working with integrated applications including (but not limited to): DocuSign, Formstack Documents, DevOps tools, Marketing Cloud
* Configure and manage Financial Service Cloud
* Manage Marketing Cloud
* Configure MuleSoft Composer
* Work closely with other Salesforce Administrators to avoid conflicts and breaking changes
* Technical documentation
* Enthusiastically teach best practices
* Performs other duties as assigned

  

**QUALIFICATIONS:*** Salesforce Certifications, Trailhead Mountaineer or higher, or demonstrated expertise configuring complex solutions within Salesforce
* Minimum 2 years of experience with hands-on business Salesforce administration
* Agile Scrum experience preferred

  

**PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATIONS:*** None required

 **TECHNICAL SKILLS:**
To be successful in this role, you should have experience with and an understanding of the following:* Salesforce Certifications (Administrator, Advanced Administer, Platform App Builder), Trailhead Mountaineer or higher, or demonstrated expertise configuring complex solutions within Salesforce

 **CULTURAL COMPETENCIES:**
In addition to our core company competencies of ***Cultivates Innovation***, ***Nimble Learning***, ***Action Oriented***, ***Collaborates***, and ***Being Resilient***, a successful candidate in this role should exhibit the following behavioral competencies:* Tech Savvy
* Communicates Effectively
* Resourcefulness
* Being Resilient

 **PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT:**
This job operates in a professional office environment and routinely uses standard office equipment. While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to speak and hear. The associate is frequently required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as stand, walk, use hands and fingers, and reach with hands and arms. This job requires the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets, and bend or stand on a stool as necessary. **DISCLAIMER/ASSOCIATE ACKNOWLEDGEMENT:**
The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time.  

  

**About Equity Trust:**  

  

Equity Trust empowers individual investors and financial professionals by removing the barriers to investment freedom. As an IRS approved custodian, we fulfill the custodial and administrative duties required for each type of investment account our clients hold.With an Equity Trust account, clients have the opportunity to invest in alternative assets such as real estate, precious metals, private equity, and more. Additionally, clients can invest in traditional assets such as stocks and mutual funds – all through a single custodian.As an industry-leading custodian of alternative assets in tax-advantaged accounts, our 45-year\\* track record of excellence is unmatched in the industry. Equity Trust streamlines the investment experience by offering optimized solutions, processes, and service.As a directed custodian, Equity Trust does not provide tax, legal or investment advice, nor do we offer or sponsor any proprietary investment products.

title: Implementation Engineer
description:
**Implementation Engineer**


**General Summary:**


Implementation Engineer is a passionate technologist with strong client-facing skills. They are responsible for the implementation of NeuroID solutions to end clients and prospects. Our Implementation engineers are hands-on with clients in order to optimize solution integration and decrease time to revenue. They are directly responsible for the alignment of technical requirements to business outcomes.


Must be exceptionally detail-oriented, a self-starter who can work independently and in a group setting.


* Proactively consult with Neuro-ID clients on best practices and processes to achieve implementation milestones
* Understand client and internal business requirements in order to manage the implementation of behavioral solutions.
* Own project management and technical delivery of embedded solutions
* Identify, resolve, and report implementation status, risks, and issues to client and Neuro-ID Leadership
* Advise clients on data collection and design requirements
* Partner with Solution Engineering to determine optimal solution strategy and implementation
* Work in coordination with client and non-client-facing team members to ensure accurate configuration and deployment
* Maintain client developer relationships and navigate through conflict and complex relationship situations to achieve business objectives
* Solve complex technical problems
* Support Pre and Post sales implementation projects to drive Neuro-ID value
* Ability to write and deliver client-facing technical documentation


Qualifications


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer engineering, IT or other equivalent majors
* 2-3 years + customer-facing implementation engineering experience
* Minimum 2-3 years of experience in IT and 2 years of experience in a Customer Service or Customer facing role are preferred
* Strong passion for IT, innovation, and business processes
* Excellent verbal and written communication and analytical skills
* Strong customer-facing skills, the ability to interact in confidence with clients
* High-energy levels paired with curiosity, an agile mindset, and a strong desire to learn business in a dynamic company
* Empathic and team-oriented hands-on mentality
* Ability to speak with senior level technology contacts
* Experience in the Fraud and Identity Industry


Technical Experience:


* Front-end web development experience including HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* Extensive experience writing vanilla JavaScript functions for the web
* Experience with webapp development environments, source control and IDEs
* Experience with webapp deployment concepts such as CI/CD, utilization of staging and QA environments
* Knowledge of HTTP request methods and concepts related to browser network traffic
* Experience building web apps using front-end frameworks such as React or Angular
* Experience utilizing iframes and familiarity with the usage of postMessage functionality
* Experience utilizing or testing REST APIs including experience with tools such as curl or Postman
* Experience developing mobile apps or mobile app SDKs.
* Experience implementing web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics
* Experience instrumenting A/B tests for the web
* Experience developing single-page application (SPA) websites
* Expertise with browser client storage (cookies, local storage)
* Experience with silent-side web app security concepts such as CSP, CORs, subresource integrity checking
* Experience developing and testing mobile apps for iOS or Android
* Experience developing or implemening SDKs for mobile app development
* Experience developing and deploying APIs  

  

Benefits
* Medical, Dental and Vision, 401K, FSA/HSA
* Competitive salary and equity package
* Technology is provided to you
* A competitive FTO package including equity (Work/life balance is VERY important to us!)
* Parental Leave (In addition to 1 year of diapers!)
* Annual meeting in Whitefish, Montana to meet with the NeuroID team
* Wellness stipend
* Annual education reimbursement

title: Mobile Developer
description:
**What we do:**


Brightwell is a full-service payments company providing thoughtful solutions and technology for sending money around the world while managing the complex regulatory requirements surrounding those transactions. Coupling technological innovation with strategic partnerships, Brightwell offers technology for businesses and individuals to expand their portfolio into cross-border payments (including bank transfers, mobile wallets, or cash). Providing unmatched fraud and transaction monitoring backed by an in-house team of global payments experts, Brightwell offers options when it comes to managing and moving money around the globe.

 **Who we need:**


Due to product growth, we are searching for a Mobile Developer to join our crew. As our ideal Mobile Developer, you will be comfortable equally comfortable writing code for iOS or Android devices and able to easily step into an agile environment with peer reviews, an in-house design team, and a QA team supporting the projects. You will collaborate with designers, developers, and product managers to reach an optimal outcome. As a Mobile Developer, you should have strong product intuition and a focus on developing highly functional software solutions.


\\*\\*This is a REMOTE position, based in the U.S. Quarterly travel to Atlanta will be required.\\*\\* Eligible states of residence: AL, CO, FL, GA, IA, IL, IN, MD, ME, PA, TX, WI


As a part of our selection process, we require all Brightwell candidates to complete a 10-minute survey which you can find here: Culture Index Survey. This confidential survey allows us to match your unique strengths with our open positions.


Still with us? Here are the details…

 **What you’ll do:**

* Design enhancements, updates, and programming changes for both Android and iOS.
* Partner with a Product Manager to refine the roadmap and deliver value.
* Assist the Director of Engineering in building a technical roadmap for our SDKs.
* Improve the SDK package delivery experience to customers.
* Drive the automated testing effort forward in collaboration with the QA team.
* Mentor junior engineers on best practices.
* Create documentation as part of development efforts.
* Consistently meet development culture guidelines and standards.
* Align with company direction using domain knowledge to provide robust scalable solutions.
* Take on other tasks and duties as assigned.

 **As a Mobile Developer, you have:**

* 5+ years of experience as a software engineer, mostly in mobile development.
* Strong knowledge of Android and iOS SDKs, different versions, and how to deal with different screen sizes.
* Familiarity with connecting mobile applications to APIs.
* Strong knowledge of UI design principles, patterns, and best practices.
* The ability to hit commitments according to agreed-upon timeframes.
* Experience providing clear and detailed communication of potential technical roadblocks.
* Experience in working on a team, in a regulated environment with shared code managed in multiple source control repositories.
* Must be eligible to work legally in the U.S. without sponsorship.

 **We’ll give you extra credit for:**

* Understanding of DevOps and deployment of Android and iOS applications.
* High-level exposure to tools such as App Center and Azure DevOps.
* Understanding of devices and memory management with regard to coding decisions.
* A high level of comfort with ambiguity and openness to learning whatever it takes to solve new challenges.
* Caring about people and how the software you make can help them.

**What we are offering in return:**

* Freedom: We trust you to do your thing and do it well.
* Professional Development: We work with you to grow your skills and push you forward.
* Entrepreneurship: We embrace new ideas and people who have the drive to see them through. If you are a doer, look no further!
* Benefits: Medical, dental, vision, disability insurance, 401k, flexible spending accounts, parental leave, paid vacation, and more.
* Random: Culture and company events (happy hours, CEO lunches, outings to Braves or United games, etc.).

***Brightwell is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) committed to employing a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture.***
