title: Full Stack Angular & Python Developer
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**:  

  

As a full-time contractor providing services as a Full Stack Software Developer utilizing; Angular, React, CSS, Python, and JavaScript. The ideal candidate will bring the necessary skills and knowledge that includes strong back-end technologies as well as knowledge and/or experience with front-end technologies.  

  

**DIRECT HIRE OPPORTUNITY**:  

  

Open offers of direct employment based on contractor’s performance outcomes.  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**:  

  

* Participate in full lifecycle development of software including analysis, design, coding, testing, implementation, deployment and support.
* Consistently write, translate, and code cloud-based applications according to specifications.
* Perform testing and analyze application and database performance on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement, resolving problems.

**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS**:  

  

* BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field from an accredited college or university preferred.
* Industry Certification in various UI and/or UX designs is a plus.
* Minimum 3 years progressive experience as a Full Stack Developer, Front End/ Back End Developer.
* Strong knowledge of and experience writing coding in Angular, React, CSS, Python, and JavaScript.
* Direct experience with Customization/Development; Database Development; Desktop Software Development (partial), Mobile App Development and Design (preferred).
* Experience and proficiency in: Lamda, Mongo DB, AWS (serverless), EC2; S3.
* Be knowledgeable of basic web architecture and design as well as knowledge of basic operating systems of either Mac or Windows.

**ADDITIONAL PROFICIENCIES NEEDED:**  

  

* A self-starter, highly motivated, and an eye for detail.
* Time management and ability to meet deadlines.
* Ability to innovate and provide functional applications with intuitive interfaces.
* Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in an ever-changing environment.
* Experience working independently (remote) and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
* Excellent communication skills.

We are looking to fill this position immediately, applicants must be located within the U.S. and meet eligibility to work in the United States. HQ is located in Las Vegas, NV; therefore you must be available to work between 8 AM to 5 PST.  

  

**JOB TYPE**: Full-time Independent Contractor Position (Remote)  

  

**COMPENSATION:** $50.00 per hour  

  

**ABOUT OUR COMPANY:**
  

  

In 2020, Social Valid’s founder had a vision to “Make our web a safer place, one verification at a time” and identified a solution in the social media space that would prevent fake accounts, bad actors, and scammers from tormenting the digital space. With the rise in content creators during the global pandemic, social media platforms have grown massively. Now in 2024, Social Valid is narrowing down solutions to help tackle Deepfakes, by creating tools to help people manage their online persona.  

  

Social Valid has launched its first set of products in 2023 with endless opportunities as we continue to innovate. Our functionality will continue to develop and change, along with our workforce. We are set to empower users to grow their brand and rise in the content creator industry.  

  

Our dedicated team of business ops and software developers strive each day to make our Mission a constant reality by “providing a recognizable “trust and verify” platform offering web accountability that simply makes us feel safer to connect and build relationships”.  

This is a remote position.

title: React Developer
description: Tell us about your department: The App Growth & Strategy team is responsible for driving and delivering experiences that increase adoption of (and engagement with) the Best Buy mobile app. We scale in-app relationship building experiences that elevate the end-to-end customer journey and drives business impact, and strengthen the app foundation to scale its role in business and customer experiences. Project Description: This team builds and maintains app-exclusive functionality, such as Best Buy Drops, iOS Live Activities, mobile home screen widgets, Apple and Google wallet integration, and so on. We also promote the mobile app using smart banners on the mobile version of BestBuy.com. Position Summary/Job Description: Best Buy is looking for a hands-on, creative, and collaborative software engineer to join our diverse team and develop high-quality cutting-edge software solutions for our mobile and web apps. In this role, you will work closely with other software engineers, product managers, and test engineers and design, develop, deploy, and debug full stack software applications. You will work closely within our agile software development process and have an important impact on the development and delivery of high-quality software solutions. What will you do? • Develop, integrate, test, deploy, debug mobile software solutions. • Evaluate new software technologies (i.e., libraries, frameworks, services) that help development to stay abreast of industry trends and standards • Take ownership of the software we build as a team, with a focus on delivering the best possible customer experience. • Contribute to the development of web-based experiences as needed. What we look for in an engineer: • Ability to take ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon, both regarding estimates and to the general process. • Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed. • A positive mindset and can-do attitude. • You’re constantly striving to learn new things and improve. You follow industry news, regularly tinker with new technologies, and read books and blogs to keep your skills current. • You work well within a team environment and enjoy working in a collaborative setting. • Ability to write well-documented, clean JavaScript or TypeScript code. • Experience working with GraphQL development • Experience developing with native iOS and/or Android SDKs • Experience working with third-party dependencies and debugging dependency conflicts. • Understanding of REST APIs. • Understanding of coding best practices and a commitment to following them. Minimum Qualifications: • Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field OR equivalent combination of education and/or experience • 2 years of hands-on experience in: o Programming with JavaScript and/or TypeScript o Developing with React Native o DevOps automation tools (GitHub Actions, Jenkins), software version control (git), and testing frameworks Preferred Qualifications: • 3+ years of relevant professional experience • 2+ years of experience with web app development How much time will the resource spend pair programming? 20 – 70% Skills Overview: What are the top five skills and number of years of experience required to perform this job? NodeJS Java with Spring framework

title: Contract – Frontend Developer
company: Volkswagen Group of America - Chattanooga Operations
description:
**Contract – Frontend Developer**


 - EA 000323 - Fully Remote
Primary Location United States-EA Home Based  

Electrify America is committed to revolutionizing the way people charge. As the country's largest open DC fast charging network, Electrify America is actively contributing to electrifying mobility today and building a more sustainable future.  



At Electrify America, we value innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to sustainability. We strive to establish a diverse and inclusive workplace where employees can develop personally and professionally. As a team member at this rapidly growing company, you can work on state-of-the-art technology and join a team making a significant impact in the world. If you're interested in joining a dynamic, innovative company, Electrify America is a place where you can learn, grow, and make a difference!

**Role Summary:**

Electrify America is looking for an experienced front end developer to further develop and support its systems including consumer facing websites as well as internal systems. The role shall continually develop technology-forward, cutting edge software solutions to address the front end systems including marketing websites and internal applications. The selected candidate will leverage experience in HTML, CSS, & javascript while maintaining UI/UX.


Proficiency in analytics tagging, media tagging, accessibility, secure coding, and search engine optimization. Responsible for coding and creating logic to support optimal functioning of client side web applications, this role will also optimize the applications for ever-increasing response time and efficiency.



The selected candidate will be key member of a team responsible for the software development lifecycle of company’s websites and mobile applications which support and manage Electrify Americas EV charging hardware. This includes Consumer marketing implementations, non-branded websites, white label app solutions, commercial applications, as well as charger HMI and custom DAM, with a goal of best-in-class digital touchpoints that are highly secure and optimized. Furthermore the developed UX/UI need to be ADA and privacy law-compliant, front and backwards compatible to allow continual updating for addition of necessary or desirable enhancements to improve the customer experience and maintain company’s market-leading position.



To be successful, the chosen candidate should be a team player with an effective communication style to persuade other developers as well as stakeholders.



Quick analysis and correct ingestion of business or functional requirements, and translation to technical requirements, together with nimble review, analysis and successful resolution of bugs or errors, are critical to this position. The front end developer will interact with other systems to store data.

**Role Responsibilities:**
**Main responsibility –Front end development 75 % of time spent**


* Write code and create logics to optimize the applications for ever-increasing response time and efficiency
* Evaluate current code base and establish a knowledgebase
* Optimize Solutions for scalability, speed and stability and regularly test speed optimization of code
* Build reusable code libraries and frameworks for future-looking implementation
* Meet regularly and work closely with internal and external developers (including front-end and UI/UX), project managers and Technology team members to develop for technology-forward, cutting edge software solutions to address website and mobile app goals, prioritizing overall quality and security, and to expose back-end issues
* Promptly review and analyze bugs/issues and create long-term solutions that take into considerations unintended consequences and impacts on other interactions
* Work alongside the Devops team to support the Development pipeline
* Interact with the database for storing data to ensure that users have access to the information sought
* Help build, maintain and improve upon a system architecture that supports frequent enhancements and updates to stay ahead of trends and innovations as well as future business needs, including load management


 **Additional responsibilities – Downstream systems and support 25 % of time**


* Prepare solutions design drawings for new and existing solutions and advise on solutions
* Implement ongoing security systems alongside the Security team, leveraging best practices, in alignment with business security objectives and priorities
* Write and maintain technical documentation in Confluence to ensure availability for ongoing reference
 **Years of Relevant Experience:**


* 5+ years


**Education:**


* Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Statistics or relevant degree or technical equivalent
* Other degree/ certification significant developer expertise


**Skills:**


* 4+ years’ experience implementing technical requirements within a solution design
* 5+ years’ experience as a front end software developer
* 4+ years proven experience as hands on front end developer or similar
* Experience in all phases of Software development life cycle (SDLC)
* Growth mindset; demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies or priorities and learn or pivot quickly
* Significant attention to detail
* Time management and organizational skills, with ability to meet tight deadlines
* Curiosity to keep learning
* Must be proactive
* Problem-solving and analytical skills: Target-oriented, driven work style with analytic problem-solving skills to translate business needs or issues into solutions
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Excellent written and oral communication, including presentation skills
* Excellent teamwork and cross-functional team management skills
* Influence and negotiation skills to influence aligned outcomes
* Integration skills to connect people, processes, and/or systems to achieve common goals
* Ability to work closely with the Enterprise, Backend, DevOps Lead and cross teams


**Specialized Skills (Required):**


* Minimum of 1 full software development lifecycle or redesign of a system
* Experience developing front end, mobile web pages
* Experience working with APIs
* Deep knowledge and proficiency in frontend coding/development using VUE, React, Angular frameworks
* Proficiency in one or more databases such as MongoDB, Oracle, SQL, and web servers (ie Apache)
* Knowledge of database storage and management, including relational/non-relational data characteristics, NoSQL databases, and web storage.
* Basic understanding of at least one backend tech such as Java/JavaScript, HTML, CSS, to support efficiency and alignment with backend developers
* Significant experience working with multiple platforms and debugging their software


**Specialized Skills (Desired):**


* Experience developing website and/or mobile application for electric vehicle (EV) charging network, or EV manufacturer, is highly desirable
* Knowledge of and experience with additional backend languages
* Experience with AWS services
* Knowledge of NPM package manager for JavaScript and experience with version control software, such as GIT
* Knowledge of and demonstrated dedication to accessibility and security compliance/best practices
* Experience working with Figma, Zeplin, Photoshop


**Work Flexibility:**


* Travel—Domestic and International, approximately 5-10%, up to 20% depending on employee location


*Electrify America is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome and encourage applicants from all backgrounds, and do not discriminate based on race, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, color, gender identity/expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable laws.*

title: Manager, Engineering: Risk and Attack Defense
description:
**Get to know Okta**

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**About Okta Risk and Attack Defense team**



Okta's Risk and Attack Defense (RAD) engineering team builds products and services that keep our customers safe. The products we build protect our customers against attack and abuse. We are a team of full stack engineers, Data Scientists, and ML engineers that are reimagining what it means to authenticate to cloud resources.



Continuously evaluating threats is critical to gaining trust and achieving security objectives. At Okta, risk plays a critical role in authentication and authorization decisions. The RAD team is building a next-gen security detection and risk platform that continuously assesses the session, device and user security posture to build a risk graph for the industry!

  


**About Okta**



Okta is an enterprise grade identity management service, built from the ground up in the cloud and delivered with an unwavering focus on customer success. With Okta you can manage access across any application, person, or device. Whether the people are employees, partners, or customers, or the applications are in the cloud, on premises, or on a mobile device, Okta helps you become more secure, make people more productive, and maintain compliance.



The Okta service provides directory services, single sign-on, strong authentication, provisioning, workflow, and built-in security toolsets. It runs in the cloud on a secure, reliable, extensively audited platform and integrates deeply with on premises applications, directories, and identity management systems.

  


**Position Description**



Okta is seeking an Engineering Manager to join its RAD engineering group. This is an opportunity to lead a group of engineers to solve critical security problems. The ideal candidate has experience building, launching and managing security products at scale.



You will share our passion and great pride in elegant solutions and will join an engineering team that strongly believes in designing for scale, rigorous code reviews, automated testing, and an iterative process to build high-quality enterprise software. You will demonstrate great aptitude for software engineering excellence and aren't afraid to be a player-coach.



Our team is fast, innovative and flexible; with agile release cycles and individual ownership. Here is an opportunity to work on stimulating security projects, emerging technologies and a chance to work on complex security and ML challenges.

  


**Job Duties and Responsibilities**


* Own and manage the design, development and delivery of cloud native security products - from concept design to final implementation.
* Manage, mentor and coach an in-house team of developers. Invest in the growth of your teammates and foster Okta's cultural values - Builder, Learner, Owner, and Collaborator.
* Influence the direction of the security products.
* Collaborate with Architects, Product Managers and Okta's in-house cybersecurity team to develop ML-first security products.
* Do design and code reviews. Commit to high standards.
* Strong cross-group collaboration and interpersonal communication skills working with a variety of roles including engineering, product management, design, support, and sales engineering
* Experience working with remote teams and individuals while ensuring agility and velocity

  


**Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities**


* 10+ years of software industry experience as an engineer, technical lead or a technical manager
* 2+ years of experience managing software development teams

  


**Nice to Haves**


* Hands on experience building Java and/or Java based web applications
* Experience building anomaly detection systems or risk systems is a huge plus.
* Experience in cloud security, identity and/or authentication protocols
* Experience building and delivering AI/ML based systems


#LI Remote

title: Sr. Product Manager - Mobile App (Remote)
description:
**Position Purpose:**


The Sr. Product Manager is responsible for assessing market needs and inspiring cross-functional product teams to find the fastest way to achieve value around those needs. The role focuses on delivering business value to drive sales, improve efficiency, and improve customer satisfaction through the production of quality products. Within their designated enterprise product line, Sr. Product Managers work closely with teams of developers, designers, and business partners. They support in-depth business reviews, communicate and present across all levels of the organization and support cross-functional product teams. Importantly, the Sr. Product Manager, must be able to work at the strategic level (generating innovative ideas for growth, change management) and at the tactical level (analyzing data, solving problems, being a force multiplier and leader of their teams). The Sr. Product Manager is often responsible for products that are higher-profile and/or that are larger in scope.

 **Key Responsibilities:**


50% Strategy & Planning:

* Seeks to empathize with and understand the end user deeply and use that knowledge to determine the fastest path to deliver value
* Translates business goals and end user needs into product strategy; communicates direction and product priorities to the development team, other matrixed teams, and third-party partners
* Identifies goals, metrics and analytics to determine product value; continually makes recommendations and refinements to the product backlog based on learnings
* Manages and grooms the product backlog; makes future decisions based on the value that will be delivered
* Partners with Finance to understand financial needs and assist in the creation of business plans for new opportunities
* Monitors research as well as the competitive landscape to recommend the best solutions and ensure that products remain or become best in class
* Ensures that product directions balance both the user needs and business goals of driving sales, improving efficiency and enhancing customer satisfaction


20% Delivery & Execution:

* Formulates, tests and refines assumptions and hypotheses through user research and testing
* Documents, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met
* Creates, prioritizes and accepts user stories; incorporate them into release planning
* Makes product decisions that drive value on a daily basis
* Identifies and considers pros, cons, issues, obstacles, dependencies and value associated with features and enhancements
* Participates in standups, iteration planning sessions, product demo, and retrospectives
* Condenses complex technical concepts into non-technical language for stakeholders


30% People:


Fosters collaboration with team members (Engineering, UX, etc.) to drive value and identify and resolve impediments


Acts as a proponent of modern software development practices


Advocates for the end user and stakeholder by becoming associated with the product, empathizing with and understanding user needs


Works with the product team to continuously assess progress, disseminate lessons learned, and understand next steps


Manages cross functional team and stakeholder expectations to execute on product strategy and provides education to requestors to determine prioritization based on tangible benefits and/or user experience


Guides more junior team members in strategy, alignment, analysis and execution tasks


Participates in and contributes to learning activities around modern software design and development core practices (communities of practice)


Participates in talent acquisition, development and retention activities in support of team

 **Direct Manager/Direct Reports:**

* Typically reports to the Product Management Manager or Sr. Manager.

 **Travel Requirements:**

* Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

 **Physical Requirements:**

* Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

 **Working Conditions:**

* Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.

 **Minimum Qualifications:**

* Must be eighteen years of age or older.
* Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.
* Must be legally permitted to work in the United States

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* 3-6 years of relevant work experience
* Experience working as a Product Manager in a modern software development based enterprise environment
* Experience with modern software development product management practices and agile methodologies, specifically the extreme programming (XP) principles of paired programming, test driven development, and continuous deployment
* Proficiency in working in a fast paced, fluid environment where priorities shift on a regular basis
* Proficiency in communicating with and influencing functional and technical team members at all levels in the organization
* Proficiency in working as part of a collaborative, cross-functional, modern software design and development team
* Proficiency in creating, prioritizing and accepting user stories
* Proficiency in conducting user research and testing to understand needs
* Proficiency in identifying goals, metrics and analytics to measure product value
* Proficiency in conducting competitive research and analysis
* Experience guiding more junior team members through Product Management fundamentals in a professional setting

 **Minimum Education:**

* The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.

 **Preferred Education:**

* No additional education

 **Minimum Years of Work Experience:**

* 3

 **Preferred Years of Work Experience:**

* No additional years of experience

 **Competencies:**

* Balances Stakeholders: Anticipating and balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders
* Business Insight: Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals
* Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
* Communicates Effectively: Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences
* Cultivates Innovation: Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful
* Customer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions
* Drives Vision and Purpose: Painting a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others to action
* Interpersonal Savvy: Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people
* Manages Complexity: Making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems
* Nimble Learning: Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder
* Organizational Savvy: Maneuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics
* Situational Adaptability: Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations
* Empathy: Understands the needs of multiple stakeholders and is responsive in meeting their needs with the most optimal resolution

title: SENIOR UX/UI DESIGNER
description:
**Location: Remote**  

**Job Type: Contract**  

**Compensation Range: $53 - 58 per hour**



Our client, a leading player in the hospitality sector, is seeking a talented **Senior UX/UI Designer** to join their dynamic team!  

  

As a Senior UX/UI Designer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the digital landscape of the hospitality industry. Reporting directly to the Senior Manager, UX/UI Design, and Senior Director, Digital Design, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact by providing strategic insights, championing best practices, and delivering cutting-edge designs that enhance user experiences across our client's digital platforms.  

  

This is a remote contract opportunity where you'll have the chance to collaborate with industry professionals and contribute to innovative digital solutions that redefine guest experiences.  

  

**Responsibilities:**


* Provide solutions to increase bookings, expand loyalty program, guest engagement, and elevate family of brands.
* Conduct competitive analysis to form educated suggestions on ways to improve the digital booking experience through testing. Use learnings to recommend ux solutions and present to Digital, Product Management, and Digital Analytics leadership.
* Maintain creative assets and update template files as necessary.
* Support marketing and property requests by mapping out efficient user journeys and intuitive content hierarchy.
* Support others to become great, passionate, talented designers.
* Document detailed user flows, define user interaction, and study competitive patterning.
* Design site maps, wireframes, page states, and prototypes.
* Full set of high-fidelity wireframes and designs for development handoff, specifically with regard to AB testing optimization.
* Guarantee deliverables are executed on target; assuring that quality standards are achieved and exceeded.
* Constantly innovate/ideate digital products and convey recommendations to senior leadership for new experiences.
* Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) as needed; giving detailed written direction to development and product teams.
* Produce user flows and architectural recommendations for digital projects of all sizes across all channels (mobile, tablet, desktop, and emerging).
* Collaborate directly with Digital Designers, Developers, Copywriters, Product Owners, Analytics, Brand Marketing, Loyalty, Content and Project Management.


**Qualifications:**


* Experience level: Experienced
* Education: Bachelors
* 5+ years of digital design experience for a world-class creative agency and/or hospitality, entertainment, or retail brand.
* App & responsive web design experience required.
* Expertise with Adobe Creative Suite.
* Expertise in product design tools, i.e. Adobe XD or similar.
* Must supply examples of work/portfolio to be considered.
* Proactive, detail-oriented, and organized; excels working collaboratively and independently.
* Strong prioritization/adaptation skills; ability to shift focus as business needs dictate.
* Highly engaged with digital products and has a passion for learning new technologies.
* Be results-driven, innovative, solutions-oriented, and curious.
* Ability to establish, strengthen, and nurture relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* Keen sense of visual, design and usability solutions.
* Solid presentation and communication skills (verbal and written).
* Expertise in information architecture and user-centric design principles.
* Understanding of CMS systems and web publishing standards/best practices; AEM a plus.
* Fluency in globalization and language best practices with regard to design a plus.
* Familiarity with Accessibility visual standards.

title: Full Stack React/Elixir Developer
description:
**Position Title: Full Stack React/Elixir Developer**


**Reports to: CEO**


**Organization: Politech**


**Position Location: Remote**


**About Politech**


Politech is the company behind Blocks, a SaaS web application for effective political advocacy. We help organizations manage and realize their policy goals by providing them with tools that assist them in tasks such as voter registration, grassroots organizing, and outreach. Our primary focus has been to assist progressive organizations that advocate on behalf of underserved communities. Our software platforms have been a vital part of keeping such organizations successful and efficient.


**Who We Are**


We are deeply committed to public service and progressive social change. We are 100% minority owned and operated with a diverse team, inclusive of gender, ethnicity, and race.


**Position Summary**


Politech seeks a Front End Developer to join our team. We are looking for an individual with excellent communication skills who will work as a team player and a self-starter. The ideal candidate should have mid-level experience, but won't be placed in some hierarchical structure. This position will work directly with the other developers and reports directly to the CEO.


The individual should be highly motivated to make a difference and to move progressive issues forward. Our employees' opinions matter to us for the success of the company and we want you to bring creative solutions to make our work better for our clients. Interest and understanding of politics and campaigns is a plus, but not required.


Our employees are from all over the country and bring varying levels of experience to the company. First and foremost, we value honesty from all employees. We strongly encourage a work environment centered on open communication and conscientiousness. Working remotely gives our employees the ability to better maintain a work-life balance, but we expect that productivity and job performance will not be sacrificed.


We are a fully remote team so you will need to be flexible to work with staff in different time zones when requested.


**Responsibilities**


* Collaborate with team on product development and feature planning
* Develop and maintain our web application with ES6
* Implement API requests and responses on the client-side
* Work closely with our designer to implement new features from mockups and prototypes using React, JSX
* Build reusable React components that can apply to a variety of use-cases throughout our app
* Improve existing React/Elixir code
* Contribute to Phoenix API and tooling
* Triage bug reports


**Minimum Qualifications**


* Minimum 2 years experience in a development role
* Demonstrated competency with Javascript and React (open source is a huge plus)
* Familiarity with concepts of RESTful APIs
* Excellent written English communication skills
* Detail oriented
* Good at receiving and giving constructive feedback


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Experience with Elixir/Phoenix
* Experience managing deployment environments (we use Ansible/Docker)
* Familiarity with mobile app development using React Native or Swift
* Familiarity with JavaScript bundling tools like Babel and Webpack
* Familiarity with GraphQL
* You care about design and user experience
* You think in systems. You're conscious of making our process more modular, reusable, and composable
* Solid grasp of DB maintenance/troubleshooting (we use Postgres)


Compensation: Salary commensurate with knowledge, experience, and qualifications.


Politech is an Equal Opportunity Employer that greatly values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

  

Job Type: Full-time

title: Software Developer (Mid-Level/Senior)
description:
**About Us**

At AllHealth CHOICE we're more than just a health and wellness company. With a small but effective team, we're on a mission to enhance our development team and make significant strides in our projects. Our CTO leads a respectful operation where every voice is valued, and smart individuals are trusted to manage their tasks with autonomy. We believe in minimal oversight and maximum innovation, providing the perfect environment for talented developers to thrive and make their mark.

**Role Overview**

We're seeking a Mid-Level or Senior Software Developer to join our agile team. This role involves working on a variety of projects, including cleaning up inherited codebases, process improvements, platform integrations, and mobile app consolidation. You'll have the chance to work with a diverse tech stack that includes Express, Vue, (maybe) PHP, and potentially contribute to our iOS and Android apps—all within an AWS environment. You will be working with the CTO, a Junior developer, project manager, and QA engineer. While the team may grow in the future, our immediate goals are better suited to a small and highly collaborative team.

**Key Responsibilities**

· Develop and maintain web and mobile applications ensuring code quality and system reliability.

· Collaborate closely with the product and engineering teams to define feature specifications and build the next generation of products.

· Take initiative in process improvement and advocate for best practices in software development.

· Engage in platform integration and consolidation projects, enhancing our product's interoperability and effectiveness.

**Required Skills and Qualifications**

· 3+ years of experience for Mid-Level, 5+ years for Senior positions.

· Experience being a team lead, including the desire to mentor teammates.

· Proficiency in Express, Vue, and Docker.

· Familiarity with Kubernetes and cloud services, ideally EKS.

· A strong problem-solving ability, excellent teamwork, and communication skills.

**Desirable Skills**

· A proactive approach to tackling challenges and improving codebase quality.

· Experience in developing iOS and Android applications.

· Experience with CI/CD, automated testing, or cloud service optimization.

· Experience with PHP

**Salary and Benefits**

· A competitive salary range based on experience and fit.

· Exceptional benefits include 401(k) matching, healthcare coverage, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance benefits.

**Why Join Us?**

AllHealth CHOICE offers an unparalleled opportunity to contribute to a growing team and shape the future of our products. Without the constraints of a large corporate structure, you'll enjoy the freedom to innovate and the satisfaction of seeing your contributions directly impact our success. Although we're small, we're ambitious—and your work here will be a cornerstone of our growth and development.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $115,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Lead Engineer, Mobile SDKs
description:
**Why PlayStation?**



PlayStation isn't just the Best Place to Play — it's also the Best Place to Work. Today, we're recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.



PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.



The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.


PlayStation Studios Mobile is looking for an experienced software engineer to design and build SDKs for mobile games built with Unity and Unreal Engine.

title: Sr. Javascript/React Developer
description:
We're building tools used by hundreds of thousands of app makers, marketers, and analysts every day, and we're looking for an experienced Javascript developer to expand the platform so our members can make more informed decisions using data.

  

### **What you'll do here:**


* Use React and TypeScript to build delightful interfaces that make it simple to get insights from complex data
* Work with and contribute to our modern stack, built with Node.js, TypeScript, and Babel
* Build modular, reusable components that work across web, server, and native, with a focus on accessibility
* React to customer issues, suggestions, and fix bugs
* Write unit and integration tests for your code with Mocha and Chai
* Work with a focused and talented team of engineers and designers
* Optimize pages and reports that must scale to high traffic


### **What we're looking for:**


* Five (5) or more years of experience building web apps with Javascript and React
* A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or an equivalent degree
* A critical thinker who can work independently and ship projects
* Great interpersonal skills and intercultural communication abilities
* Working knowledge of modern web frameworks
* A methodical approach to debugging complex issues
* A healthy curiosity and desire to learn
* An appreciation for the world of mobile apps and games

  

  

One of the reasons we started Appfigures was to create a place where we would love to work. That's why we sweat the small details to bring every team member the best, most thought-out, benefits around:


### **Benefits:**


* Excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance
* 401K
* Plenty of paid time-off
* Excellent gear
* Pre-tax benefits, subsidized gym memberships, and more
* A dynamic work environment with a flexible work schedule
* Company sponsored outings


### **What you should know about us:**


* We take pride in our friendly and stress-free work atmosphere
* We are self-funded and profitable, which lets us build the products we wish existed
* Every member of our team has a voice in shaping the future of the company as a whole

title: Mobile Engineer
description:
At Cardata, our goal is to provide cost-effective and accurate ways to reimburse drivers for using their personal vehicles for work. We partner closely with our customers to provide best-in-class support, service and technology to Drive What Matters for them and their employees.  

  

We recently secured an investment of over $100M to fuel our **vision** of building a complete vehicle management platform. Read more here.  

  

**Who You Are**  

We are seeking a dedicated mobile developer (Android specific) to join our new Cardata Mobile team. You will collaborate as part of a team of developers to work on creating and maintaining the Cardata mobile applications. As a main Android developer, you will need to be familiar with the Android ecosystem and mobile app development, including familiarity with popular app frameworks and software development best practices. You will be responsible for maintaining existing codebases, including bug fixing while following all coding guidelines and industry best practices. As an intermediate engineer on our small but mighty engineering team, your work will have a high impact and influence on the direction and evolution of the Cardata product!  


### **What You'll Be Doing**

* Participate in bi-weekly sprint planning and retrospective sessions to ensure developments are properly scoped and scheduled
* Design and develop apps for the Android ecosystem, including fixing known bugs in existing Android applications and adding new features
* Work with external software libraries and APIs
* Ensure cross-platform optimization for mobile phones and responsiveness of applications
* Collaborate with team members to create web and mobile design features based on customer feedback and company needs
* Stay up to date on developments in web applications and programming languages

### **What You'll Bring**

* 5+ years of software development experience
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or an equivalent educational experience (ex. Brainstation, Lighthouse Labs)
* Solid understanding of common programming tools and paradigms, such as version control, use of frameworks, and common design patterns
* Proficiency with Android Studio and Android SDK tools
* Excellent knowledge of the Java programming language
* Familiarity with mobile applications and development, including the use of hardware such as accelerometers, cameras, and gyroscopes
* Comfortable working as part of a cross-functional team and with code written by others
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze situations and develop effective solutions in a timely manner
* Collaborative and team-oriented
* Knowledge of React Native is a strong asset

**Why you’ll love working at Cardata:**  

Cardata provides you with a flexible, autonomous environment that encourages employees to experiment, innovate and learn. As part of our team, you will be surrounded by supportive leaders and caring colleagues who are dedicated to taking on new challenges, focusing on the customer, and working as a team to achieve success. Additionally, you will be provided with:  

Opportunity for career progression in a growing company
Competitive salary + bonus
Opportunity to work remotely
Flexible working hours
Medical & Dental Benefits with 100% employer paid premiums
Healthcare spending account
Wellness spending account
15 days of vacation + additional time off throughout the year
3 pit-stop days (Cardata's version of mental health days) *Cardata is an equal opportunity employer. All candidates will be equally considered without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, language, citizenship, creed, religion, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, physical and/or mental handicap or financial ability. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome to bring their authentic selves to work.* *If you require accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know.*

title: Mobile Apps Developer (Remote)
description:
We're seeking a passionate individual who can provide engaging video content about the mobile app development industry.

**Responsibilities:**

* Produce a video discussing various aspects of mobile app development based on provided questions.
* Creatively convey insights into the industry's growth, roles within development teams, daily tasks, crucial concepts, advantages, and technological aspects.

**Requirements:**

* Proficiency in mobile app development concepts, platforms, and languages.
* Excellent communication skills for video creation and conveying complex ideas concisely.
* Demonstrated ability to deliver engaging and informative content.

**How to Apply:**

* Create a video answering the provided questions in detail.
* Ensure clear audio and a white background for visibility.
* Send your video to mailto:monica.sanchez@learnquest.com
* **Applicants without a submitted video will not be considered.**

**Questions to Address in Your Video:**

1. What are the driving forces behind the mobile app development industry's growth, and how has it evolved in the past decade?  
2. Can you delineate the various roles within a mobile app development team and elucidate how their responsibilities differ across native, cross-platform, and hybrid app development settings?  
3. Could you guide us through a typical day in the life of a mobile app developer, emphasizing the main tasks and challenges encountered during the development journey?  
4. What are the indispensable terms and concepts that every aspiring mobile app developer should grasp, and how do they contribute to establishing a robust foundation in app development?  
5. In your perspective, what are the key advantages of mobile app development in comparison to other software development domains, and how do these benefits influence career prospects in this field?  
6. How pivotal is cloud computing in contemporary mobile app development, and what advantages does it provide in terms of scalability, data storage, and accessibility?  
7. Can you outline the mobile app development process, encompassing the key stages and activities from concept ideation to deployment?  
8. How can the integration of DevOps principles and practices bolster the efficiency of mobile app development projects, and what cultural adjustments are essential for successful implementation?  
9. Elaborate on the core principles of Agile methodology within the realm of mobile app development and discuss the benefits of utilizing Agile frameworks like Scrum or Kanban.  
10. Compare and contrast the major mobile operating systems, Android and iOS, highlighting their strengths and limitations for app developers.  
11. Offer insights into the selection of mobile app development platforms such as Xamarin, Ionic, Capacitor, and React, and analyze scenarios where each platform excels.  
12. Delve into the significance of programming languages such as Swift, JavaScript, and Kotlin in mobile app development, and provide your perspective on their suitability for specific app types.

Join us in shaping the future of mobile app development! We look forward to receiving your insightful video

title: E-Commerce Technical Support Personnel
description:
Job Requirements and Qualifications:  

* At least 1 year of work experience as a Customer service representative and/or technical support expert
* Knowledge of customer service principles and practices, and working with difficult clients.
* Knowledge to navigate hardware, software, network, operating systems, and protocol
* Experience in the e-commerce field will be PLUS

  

MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  

  

* Coordinate and support all of the activities of the Technical Support team to ensure an effective support service for digital signage systems and related equipment.
* Manage, develop, administer and technically support the technology infrastructure for EZ-AD
* Understand Database & Technical systems for you to be able to effectively assist the customer
* Work with a cool developer team and project managers so they can build out better systems for you and the customers!
* Provide technical support to Technical Support Team (including both internal and external users), covering both hardware and software systems, in accordance with the company’s agreed service standards.
* Escalate all unresolved service issues to the Technical Services Manager.
* Implement agreed-on procedures for hardware and software audit, security, and inventory.
* Participate actively and flexibly in a range of company activities, such as daily meetings, call schedules, and customer conference calls.
* Participate in training and team development activities to update skills and knowledge.

  

You will be receiving extensive training in Technical knowledge, including understanding programming fundamentals and database management. You will learn how to figure out people’s problems by looking at database tables and some basic code, and working with developers on getting the solutions completed for our clients!  

  

ABOUT US  

  

We are EZ-AD - a focused team of talented and skilled individuals dedicated to creating beautiful software that provides real value to our users!!  

  

We do several projects for large companies such as Disney, Verizon, Red Bull, ADP, Dippin Dots, Ace Hardware, True Value, and many others companies.  

  

We are continuously growing and seeking new people to join our team. If you are PASSIONATE about TECHNOLOGY, love your work, and love interacting with new people to strive to make great things happen, then this opportunity is for you!  

  

A few of our cool projects:  

  

https://disney.ezad.io/cruella/  

https://disney.ezad.io/raya-experience/  

  

What is EZ-Commerce?  

EZ-Commerce is an advanced e-commerce platform for hardware retailers that allows you to become your own Amazon and Uber all in one. Some key features are the automatic integration of products right from your POS system to showcase on your website (which can be completely customized) and a unique user experience allowing your customers to purchase right on the go.  

Available both on desktop and mobile responsive, you can get all your orders to sync into your POS and also push to our EZ-AD manager app allowing you to make delivery and pick up right from your business.  

EZ-Commerce is being used by 2,000 hardware stores; it has processed over a hundred million products and 25 million dollars in orders; We are proud to say that our technology has become an essential part of our client's success.  

What our Success Specialist can expect from us:  

We are a supportive group of “A players” and a big family that cares about the well-being of our organization's members. We offer the opportunity to go through great and difficult challenges and come victorious altogether.  


Remote

title: Developer Support Engineer
description:
### **About us:**



RevenueCat makes building, analyzing, and growing mobile subscriptions easy. We launched as part of Y Combinator's summer 2018 batch and today are handling more than $2B of in-app purchases annually across thousands of apps.



We are a mission driven, remote-first company that is building the standard for mobile subscription infrastructure. Top apps like VSCO, Notion, and ClassDojo count on RevenueCat to power their subscriptions at scale.



Our 70 team members (and growing!) are located all over the world, from San Francisco to Madrid to Taipei. We're a close-knit, product-driven team, and we strive to live our core values: Customer Obsession, Always Be Shipping, Own It, and Balance.

### **About us:**



We're looking for a Developer Support Engineer to help provide a great experience for developers integrating the RevenueCat SDK into their apps. As a member of our support engineering team, you'll work directly with our customers each day to help them ship their apps. You'll also collaborate with Engineering and Product to create an excellent developer experience and achieve our mission of helping developers make more money.


### **About you:**


* You have 3-5 years experience in an engineering or technical role.
* You have experience integrating and shipping RevenueCat in a mobile app.
* You have an understanding of the mobile development and release process.
* You have experience in iOS (Swift / Objective-C), Android (Java / Kotlin), React Native, Flutter or Unity.
* You have great debugging skills: You will be identifying why apps aren't working, often with limited information.
* You have experience debugging code issues utilizing stack traces.
* You have an interest in "wearing many hats," doing what it takes to help developers every day.
* You have excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills: You will be writing to, presenting to and speaking with developers and colleagues daily.
* You have empathy for developers and their development/learning process: we usually hear from developers at their lowest and need to be understanding.
* You have a demonstrated creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills.
* You're able to overlap your core working hours with Central Time Zone.

### **In the first month, you'll:**


* Learn the common frustrations our customers have, and help them get unblocked to ship their apps
* Learn the internal tools and processes used by the support team
* Make improvements to our docs and support articles based on customer interactions to reduce support
* Work with our engineering team to untangle complex tickets

### **Within the first 3 months, you'll:**


* Make product suggestions that will improve the developer experience and reduce support
* Build internal apps to test and reproduce issues
* Work directly with customers to assist with onboarding and solution engineering

### **Within the first 6 months, you'll:**


* Identify key problem areas for developers and make targeted improvements that help developers
* Improve and create internal tools and dashboards for support and other internal processes
* Make significant contributions to the support process that helps you and your teammates be more efficient

### **Within the first 12 months, you'll:**


* Develop a super-hero like intuition for the root causes of tickets and become an expert troubleshooter
* Interview, hire and mentor additional support engineers
* Discover new and unexpected ways to delight developers with our support experience

### **What we offer:**


* $130,000 USD Salary regardless of your location
* Competitive equity in a fast-growing, Series B startup backed by top tier investors including Y Combinator
* 10 year window to exercise vested equity options
* Fully remote work environment that promotes autonomy and flexibility
* Suggested 4 to 5 weeks time off to recharge and focus on mental, physical, and emotional health
* $2,000 USD to build your personal workspace
* $1,000 USD annual stipend for your continuous learning and growth


Curious about the interview process? Discover more in our blog post about how we hire and learn tips to help you succeed.

title: Accessibility Tester (Quality Assurance, Remote US)
description:
**Skills**:

* 5+ years of experience in testing web and mobile applications.
* 4+ years of experience for accessibility testing.
* Strong knowledge of Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 1 & 2) and Section 508
* Knowledge in HTML, XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, ARIA, Jenkins.
* Experience with automating accessibility test cases for both Web and Mobile applications.
* Experience in A11y testing on various operating systems such as MAC/WINDOWS and browsers which includes IE/Firefox/Chrome/Safari.
* Experience in various A11y tools - JAWS, NVDA, FireBug, Color Contrast Analyzer, Voice Over, WAVE, Axe, Talk Back, Zoom Text.
* Experience with creating test strategies, plans and test execution for web and mobile applications.
* Experience testing of backend applications and APIs developed in Java/C# with SQL, NoSQL, ActiveMQ and caching technologies such as Hazelcast
* Experience testing for apps with Web UI on multiple browsers (IE, Firefox, Safari, Chrome) and operating systems (Linux, Windows, iOS)
* Experience with source control versioning systems (Git, Stash, Bitbucket.)
* Must have good understanding of network topologies and technologies
* Experience in defect tracking tools (JIRA, Bugzilla, etc.)
* Experience with source control versioning systems (Git, Stash, Bitbucket.)
* Knowledge in software testing methodology and the SDLC.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience.

**Responsibilities**:

* Participate in developing and documenting user stories, including testing estimates and validation tests.
* Develop, document, and maintain the test strategy and test scenarios.
* Partner with the developers to ensure all areas of the application are fully tested and issues are clearly logged and prioritized consistently.
* Manage the defect log and ensure issues are resolved, including validation of the fix.
* Work with integration build teams to manage dev, QA and production release of software.

* Evaluate product requirements to create, modify, and execute test cases for functional testing (manual) and report results in a clear, concise manner to another member of the Agile team.
* Report and troubleshoot bugs directly with developers on the Agile team.
* Effectively communicate test plans, test reports, and test metrics to team.
* Perform manual functional and regression testing in a wide variety of areas from mobile/web app and analytics to hardware firmware.

title: Business Applications Consultant (Construction Focused)
description:
Are you ready to take on a pivotal role as our Business Applications Consultant, where your technology and construction industry skills come together to make an impact on clients?

Join our dynamic team and make a significant impact as you collaborate with clients, predominately from the construction sector, guiding them through the implementation and continuous utilization of our cutting-edge software tools to tackle complex data-related challenges.

Syscon, Inc, established in 1986, provides technology solutions and computer technical support services to our clients. We care deeply about our clients and at Syscon Inc, we foster a culture where our company, employees, and clients grow and succeed together.

**As a successful member of our Syscon team, YOU:**

* Care and are compassionate about people, treat clients and each other with respect.
* Empower our clients to use tech and see each task, whether mundane, as an opportunity to help to take away our client’s pain points.
* Have a team mentality - it’s always “we”, never “me” or never a “not my job” attitude. Everyone on our team owns their part. Have no ego, no drama; we’re a team. Nothing is beneath us.
* Ask for help, dive in, and dig deep to find the solutions.
* Take pride in self-initiative, put in the work, show an ownership mentality, and own your part.
* Embrace growth, readily accept constructive feedback, see your mistakes as opportunities to learn rather than seeing them as blame.
* Give and receive feedback (good and bad) and use it to improve self and your work.

**We believe that you will be successful in the Business Applications Consultant role if you have:**

* Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience serving in a support role capacity in a professional office setting
* IT service industry or MSP experience a plus
* Construction industry knowledge highly desirable.
* A great attitude
* Love to learn and possess a curious mindset to discover more

**As our Key Business Applications Consultant, in working with our clients, your objectives:**

* Define and create Microsoft Power BI Reports
* Improve business workflows using Microsoft tools and/or define custom applications that we build
* Deploy custom reports within the ERP (Sage 100 Contractor, a SQL Server based application with a built-in report writer)
* Rolle out and provide ongoing support for our custom-built applications, ensuring seamless integration into our clients' operations
* Implement and support our custom-built mobile app designed for construction field time collection

**Skills and competencies you need for success in the role**

* Previous related work experience in customer service and consultancy
* Knowledge of computer system validation process
* Ability to evaluate, facilitate and drive towards risk-based decision making
* Experience implementing, training, and supporting end users on new business tools and applications
* Working knowledge on database querying (i.e SQL) and writing SQL Server queries
* Experience with Microsoft Power BI
* Experience with Microsoft Power Automate
* Advanced Excel skills
* Extreme problem-solving skills including ability to analyze, anticipate and resolve complex issues (technical, operational or business-related)
* Strong communication skills; including documentation, end user communication, and communication with developers
* Strong personal skills including effective time management, self-driven, and prioritization
* Bonus skills: Experience creating SharePoint sites and experience with Microsoft Power Apps

**Come grow with us and make a difference! APPLY HERE if you're interested in:**

* Making a big impact in a small company and fast-growing company
* Working and communicating with a smart team of tech professionals
* We’re a small company and your input will carry a lot of weight in getting things done.

**Perks & Benefits**

* A place to grow your skills and career.
* People. Work with a talented, committed, and supportive team.
* Excellent medical, dental and vision benefits.
* Unlimited PTO

title: Junior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Innovare**

Innovare - Social Innovation Partners, Inc. is a social enterprise founded in July 2017, focused on improving education to accelerate social change. Our cloud-based web application supports and empowers education leaders to drive continuous improvement in their organizations and to impact the people they serve. We are expanding rapidly and want you to be part of our team of educators, private sector transplants, data, and tech experts working together toward equity.

**About the Engineering Team**

The Engineering team is a team of problem solvers that executes the product strategy to address the challenge of accelerating improvements in student outcomes. Our users are education leaders at schools, districts, and nonprofits who use our app, Inno™, to make data-driven decisions, develop strategic plans, and collaborate with their teams to implement their plans. Now, the team wants to improve the user experience of existing features, use emerging technologies to guide our users to succeed, and onboard new segments of users to create the supporting ecosystem our education leaders need to thrive and reach their organization's goals. The ideal Jr. Full Stack Engineer enjoys learning, is a quality leader, shares knowledge with team members, is proactive and anticipates challenges, provides innovative solutions, and works collaboratively across the company to enable our product-led growth strategy.

**Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with the Engineering team in ideation, planning, development, and launch of the product
* Participate in user research to understand the needs of customers and end-users and provide insights to the Engineering team
* Provide insights and feedback on product strategy and roadmap, as requested
* Execute on product strategy in the form of developing high-quality product features that are technically excellent, aesthetically appealing, and easy to use
* Support the Engineering team to ensure the success of the product post-launch by reviewing product analytics and qualitative data to understand the impact of product changes for our users and for the company
* Build internal processes to improve the functioning of the team, as requested
* Implement quality best practices in their code, collaboration, and release process
* Engage with the education, social impact, and tech community, stay abreast of best practices and emerging technology, and develop new skills to improve Innovare’s products

**Minimum Qualifications**

* B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
* 2 years of software development experience (front-end/back-end and web/mobile apps), certification as a full stack developer from a reputable bootcamp, or equivalent working experience in a collaborative environment
* Knowledge of designing and implementing a full-stack cloud application (cloud service, database, queries, middleware, front-end development, back-end development)
* Experience with but not limited to the following: React, Node, Express, Postgres HTML/CSS, Chart libraries, API, Google Cloud, Git, VSCode,
* Experience with Agile Kanban or Scrum Methodologies and productivity apps (JIRA, Asana, Trello, etc.)
* Problem solver and manages risks that arise while communicating those risks appropriately to the team
* Motivated to grow personally and professionally with particular excitement to learn new technologies
* Self-discipline to stay focused on value-add activities and meeting deadlines
* Detail-oriented with a focus on product quality and a great user experience
* Able to thrive in a highly collaborative environment at a macro and micro-level (strategic planning, pair programming, code reviews, brainstorming)
* Exceptional focus on the quality of their work
* Familiar with the state of the art in software engineering across the stack

**Preferred Qualifications**

* *Ideally we are looking for a candidate who has k-12 education experience, particularly in data, teaching or leadership*
* Understanding of the education sector, EdTech work experience, and highly motivated to contribute to positive social impact
* An impressive portfolio with a great eye for design
* Machine Learning feature development experience
* Big Data experience (Data Lakes, Data Pipelines, ETL, and Data Warehouses)
* Experience with product analytics tools, such as Segment, Mixpanel, and FullStory
* Understanding of data privacy laws and cybersecurity threats
* Ability and willingness to travel 10% of the time
* Proficient in English and Spanish
* Aspirations to become a leader within the Engineering team and beyond

**Benefits**

* Company-paid top-notch health, dental, vision, and disability Insurance
* Personal and professional development opportunities
* Flexible schedule with home office days
* Paid company holidays and vacation
* A diverse team where you can be yourself 100% of the time and can share all of your ideas
* Opportunity to shape and scale our impact-driven organization

Innovare is committed to and advocates for diversity, equity, and inclusion in technology and society. Women, non-binary and gender non-conforming people, all members of the LGBTQ+ community and/or Black, Indigenous, and all people of color are especially encouraged to apply.

* Vision insurance

* 2 years

title: C++ Software Developer (xHarbour, FiveWin)
description:
Join our U.S. software company as a full-time developer and help bridge the gap between our legacy software, including Clipper, xHarbour, and Fivewin, and our new modern web/mobile application built on Tailwind and Svelte.

Our legacy software was originally developed as a DOS-based Payroll Processing Software written in Clipper and was later upgraded to a Windows application with FiveWin and xHarbour. We have since developed a modern cloud-based Time & Attendance web/mobile app using Tailwind and Svelte.

We are seeking experienced developers to help speed up the development process and ensure a smooth transition to our modern web application platform.

**Responsibilities:**

- Maintain and update legacy code written in Clipper, FiveWin, and xHarbour  
- Modify and enhance the legacy software to integrate with modern technologies and platforms  
- Integrate new features into the software  
- Troubleshoot and debug issues  
- Ensure compatibility and smooth transition between old and new software versions

**Requirements:**

- Must be available Mon-Fri from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM Pacific Standard Time  
- Proficiency in Clipper, FiveWin, and xHarbour.  
- Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and Javascript, Svelte is a plus  
- Familiarity with APIs and integrating third-party libraries  
- Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment  
- Experience in maintaining and updating legacy software products  
- Ability to adapt to changing technologies and implement modern solutions while preserving legacy functionality

Please note that this is not an entry-level position. Previous experience as a C++ Developer or similar role is required.

If you are a talented developer looking for an exciting opportunity to combine your knowledge of legacy and modern software, we’d love to hear from you!

title: AWS Serverless Developer
description:
Returned.com is a consumer-centric startup founded in 2023 to revolutionize the tedious returns process for shoppers. By leveraging a patent pending AI platform to handle all return logistics, the company aims to ease consumer frustrations and position itself as a leading end-to-end returns solution focused entirely on simplicity for the customer.

We are looking for a mid-senior level AWS Serverless Developer to join our remote IT team. In this role, you will collaborate with a small team to architect, build and manage the serverless backend infrastructure that powers our mobile app. At Returned.com, we prioritize not only the functionality but also the quality of our codebase, investing in regular refactoring to ensure scalability, maintainability, and efficiency.

**Responsibilities**:

Design and implement scalable cloud functions, APIs, and datastores

Troubleshoot and optimize performance of serverless applications

Integrate serverless infrastructure with other AWS services

Follow best practices around security, monitoring, and automation

Regularly review and refactor code to improve quality and maintainability

**Requirements:**

title: Project Manager | Salesforce Administrator
description:
Position Description

This will be a full-time position working remotely.

The Project Manager | Salesforce Specialist will work independently and alongside a team of project managers, developers, and consultants. With strong knowledge of Salesforce best practices, technical configurations skills, and the ability to gather requirements, the Project Manager | Salesforce Specialist will work with clients to gather requirements, build & present solutions, manage timeline, budget and deliverables, train clients, and ensure overall project success. We work as a team to ensure long-term success and deliver solutions that our customers can count on.

**DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Undergo deep, technical business process discovery and create trusted solutions built on best practices.
* Work directly with clients to translate business objectives into technical requirements.
* Communicate directly with clients and manage implementations and customization projects.
* Accurately manage budget, scope, risks, and issues during project lifecycle process.
* Customize Salesforce including layouts, detail pages, custom objects and flows in Salesforce Lightning.
* Fluent in Salesforce Administration/Configuration (including Flows, Validation Rules, Object Structures, Data Migrations).
* Familiar with Integration techniques of Salesforce and other applications.
* Responsible for direct ownership of a particular project or work stream for larger projects.
* Develop and execute system test scripts and facilitate User Acceptance Testing; build and deploy change sets.
* Stay up to date with new features and product launches from Salesforce and other technology partners.
* Develop trusted and synergetic relationships with clients, partners, and other stakeholders.

**EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
* A minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar role working with clients in a consulting capacity.
* Experience with project management methodologies and familiarity with best practices as it relates to Salesforce projects.
* Strong knowledge of standard Lightning components and Lightning App Pages.
* One or more current Salesforce certificates (Admin, Consultant certifications, Platform Developer I, App Builder).
* Ability to preserve confidential and sensitive customer and company information.
* Ability to present solutions and gather requirements from various business levels include c-suite.
* Willingness to travel up to 10% on occasion.

**SKILLS**

* Must possess time management/communication skills, core delivery skills, critical thinking skills and reliable while adjusting to changes in priorities.
* English proficiency – Fluent in business language.
* Highly organized, detail oriented and able to follow written and verbal instructions.
* Ability to work under pressure amid distractions and interruptions while maintaining a positive attitude.
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills with ability to interact with clients regularly via email, phone and in-person in a timely manner.
* Comfortable communicating with C-Level Executives.
* Must have high moral and ethical standards, be trustworthy, honest, and have a high regard for integrity and reliability.
* Demonstrate a high level of business acumen and ability to understand business process across many industries.
* Ability to speak and write accurately and elegantly about technical software offerings and our solutions.
* Maintain a professional appearance and demonstrate proper business etiquette.
* Self-starter, confident, entrepreneurial mindset and ability to work independently or in a group.
* Must have reliable internet connection with computer and mobile phone.

title: Data Analyst - Ad Tech - Remote
description:
**About Motive Interactive**
----------------------------


Motive Interactive is one of the top Mobile Ad Networks in the world, come join a team with an amazing future. Motive is seeking creative, driven, and out of the box thinkers to join our growing distributed workforce.


Motive has been recognized by numerous publications including Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing companies in the United States. Motive is at the forefront of Mobile App Marketing and a proven leader in user acquisition for apps.

--------------------

* Analyze and interpret data using a range of analysis and presentation tools and make recommendations for actions to optimize marketing performance
* Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and guide applicable next steps

* Develop and present learnings from analyses, including actionable insights and recommendations

This is a remote position.

title: OpenText Xpression , Exstream Developer - Complete Remote Opportunity
description:
**Company Description**  

Arthur Grand (AG) is an IT services firm specializing in Digital Transformation initiatives for Federal, Commercial, State & local customers. Since 2012, AG has (been) successfully supporting and delivering IT services to our customers in the areas of enterprise modernization and transformation with a core focus on emerging technologies including Cloud Solutions (AWS, Azure), Agile Development and Custom Programming, Full Stack Development, DevOps, DevSecOps, & CI/CD, Web & Mobile APP Development, Data Visualization and Data Warehousing, Financial/ERP System Implementation, Infrastructure Management. Arthur Grand’s culture of (delivery excellence) or excellent delivery, combined with a commitment to bring the best talent to provide services, has earned our company an unparalleled reputation for delivering transformative results.
